sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Processes and Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee, which is comprised entirely of independent directors, administers our senior executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions for all senior executive officers are approved by the Compensation Committee and recommended by the Committee to the full Board for final approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers recommendations from our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer in setting compensation for senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to attendance by members of the Compensation Committee, the Committees meetings are also regularly attended by our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, our Senior Vice President of Administration and Human Resources Department employees, as well as managements and the Boards compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each meeting the Committee also meets in executive session without members of management present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chairman of the Committee reports the Committees recommendations on executive compensation to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Human Resources, Tax and Finance Departments support the Compensation Committee in its duties, and the Committee may delegate authority to these departments to fulfill administrative duties relating to our compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has the authority under its Charter to retain, approve fees for, and terminate advisors, consultants and others as it deems appropriate to assist in the fulfillment of its responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to this authority, the Committee engages the services of its own independent compensation consultant, Pearl Meyer & Partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management engages the services of Willis Towers Watson as its executive officer and director compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In consultation with Pearl Meyer & Partners, the Committee also uses relevant information provided by Willis Towers Watson to assist it in carrying out its responsibilities for overseeing matters relating to compensation plans and compensation of our senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using information provided by Willis Towers Watson, which is a national compensation consultant, helps assure the Committee that our policies for compensation and benefits are competitive and aligned with utility and general industry practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee believes that also engaging its own independent compensation consultant eliminates the appearance of any potential conflict of interest that might arise because managements consultant also performs other services for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pearl Meyer & Partners does not perform any additional services for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has assessed the independence of Pearl Meyer & Partners pursuant to Securities and Exchange Commission rules and New York Stock Exchange Listing Standards and determined that Pearl Meyer & Partners work for the Compensation Committee does not raise any conflict of interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, decisions on various elements of executive compensation were made by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No officer, employee, former officer or any related person of SCANA or any of its subsidiaries served as a member of the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The directors who served on the Compensation Committee during 2016 were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. James A. Bennett (Chairman since April 2016 Mr. John F. A. V. Cecil Mrs. Sharon A. Decker Mr. James M. Micali Mr. James W. Roquemore Mr. Maceo K. Sloan (Chairman until April 2016) Mr. Harold C. Stowe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Human Resources, Risk Management, and Legal Departments have jointly reviewed our compensation policies and procedures to determine whether they present a significant risk to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review we have concluded that our compensation policies and procedures for all employees are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our annual incentive compensation plans for all employees are structured such that appropriate limits are in place to discourage excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all leadership level employees who are in a position to effect significant policies or projects have compensation at risk on both a short- and long-term basis, which we believe discourages excessive risk taking and encourages supervision of any risk related activities by other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation programs and policies, including our senior executive officer share ownership requirements, reward consistent, long-term performance by heavily weighting leadership level compensation to long-term incentives that reward stock, financial, and operating performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all of our senior executive officers, who are also members of our Risk Management Committee, oversee and approve individual and business unit objectives for their areas of responsibility so they are positioned to report any risk associated with such individual or business unit objectives to the Risk Management Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Objectives and Philosophy of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior executive compensation program is designed to support our overall objective of increasing shareholder value by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hiring and retaining premier executive talent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having a pay-for-performance philosophy that links total rewards to achievement of corporate, business unit and individual goals, and places a substantial portion of pay for senior executives at risk;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aligning the interests of executives with the long-term interests of shareholders through long-term equity-based incentive compensation; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensuring that the elements of the compensation program focus on and appropriately balance our financial, customer service, operational and strategic goals, all of which are crucial to achieving long-term results for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have designed our compensation program to reward senior executive officers for their individual and collective performance and for our collective performance in achieving goals for growth in earnings per share and total shareholder return and other annual and long-term business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our program performs a vital role in keeping executives focused on improving our performance and enhancing shareholder value while rewarding successful individual executive performance in a way that helps to assure retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discussion provides an overview of our compensation program for all of our senior executive officers (for 2016, a group of 11 people who are at the level of senior vice president and above), as well as a specific discussion of compensation for our Chief Executive Officer, our Chief Financial Officer and the other executive officers named in the Summary Compensation Table that follows this Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this discussion, we refer to the executives named in the Summary Compensation Table as Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Principal Components of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, senior executive compensation consisted primarily of three key components: base salary, short-term cash incentive compensation, and long-term equity-based incentive compensation (under the shareholder-approved Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide various additional benefits to senior executive officers, including health, life and disability insurance plans, retirement plans, change in control arrangements, limited perquisites, and, if appropriate, severance and termination benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee makes its decisions about how to allocate senior executive officer compensation among base salary, short-term cash incentive compensation and long-term equity-based incentive compensation on the basis of market information and analysis provided by managements compensation consultant, and our goals of remaining competitive with the compensation practices of a group of surveyed companies and of linking compensation to our corporate performance and individual senior executive officer performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also evaluate the market information for specific positions and consider internal equity issues when making pay adjustments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Committees discretion, information used or provided by management, or provided by managements compensation consultant to assist the Committee in making its decisions, may be reviewed by the Committees independent compensation consultant, Pearl Meyer & Partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A more detailed discussion of each of these components of senior executive officer compensation, the reasons for awarding such types of compensation, the considerations in setting the amounts of each component of compensation, the amounts actually awarded for the periods indicated, and various other related matters are set forth in the sections below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors Considered in Setting Senior Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Market Surveys and Peer Group Data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe it is important to consider comparative market information about compensation paid to executive officers of other companies in order to remain competitive in the executive workforce marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We want to attract and retain highly skilled and talented senior executive officers who have the ability to carry out our short- and long-term goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To do so, we must be able to compensate them at levels that are competitive with compensation offered by other companies in our business or geographic marketplace that seek similarly skilled and talented executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we consider market survey results in establishing all components of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The market survey information is provided to us approximately every other year by managements compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In years in which managements consultant does not provide us with market survey information, and when we require updated information, our process may be to apply an aging factor to the prior years information with assistance from managements consultant, based on its experience in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions for 2016 were based on a compensation survey performed in 2015 by managements compensation consultant, Willis Towers Watson.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to managements consultant conducting the market survey, we assist managements consultant in understanding the key duties and responsibilities of our positions, which enables the consultant to match our positions with benchmark positions in its database.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If managements consultant is unable to find an exact match for one of our positions in the consultants database due to variances in duties and/or position level, we may assist managements consultant in identifying the most similar position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The market survey information may then be adjusted upward or downward as necessary to match the position as closely as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to set base salary and short- and long-term incentive compensation for our senior executive officers at the median (50  percentile) of compensation paid for similar positions by the companies included in the market surveys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally set our target at the median because we believe this target will meet the requirements of most of the persons we seek to hire and retain in our geographic area, and because we believe it is fair both to us and to the executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Variations to this objective may, however, occur as dictated by the experience level of the individual, internal equity, need for specialized talent, and market factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not set a target level for broad-based benefits for our senior executive officers, but we believe our broad-based benefits are approximately at the median.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies included in the market survey are a group of utilities and general industry companies of various sizes in terms of revenue.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately half of the companies included in the 2015 market survey had substantially the same levels of annual revenues as we had, while the remainder had revenues ranging from one-third to not greater than 3.8 times our revenues with the exception of the inclusion of three utilities that are geographically close to us and have nuclear operations and are competitors for our talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market survey results for positions may be size-adjusted using regression analysis to account for these differences in company revenues, which in turn are viewed as a proxy for measuring the relative scope and complexity of the business operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the utilities included in our market survey are an appropriate group to use for compensation comparisons because they align well with our revenues (other than three utilities included because they are geographically close to us, have nuclear operations and are competitors for our talent), the nature of our business and workforce, and the talent and skills required for safe and successful operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the additional non-utility companies included in our market
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: survey are appropriate to include in our comparisons because they align well with our revenues, and are the types of companies that might be expected to seek executives with the same general skills and talents as the executives we are trying to attract and retain in our geographic area.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies we use for comparisons may change from time to time based on the factors discussed above as well as their participation in the consultants executive compensation surveys.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To make comparisons with the market survey results, we generally divide all of our senior executive officers into utility and non-utility executive groups  that is, executive officers whose responsibilities are primarily related to utility businesses and require a high degree of technical or industry- specific knowledge (such as electrical engineering, nuclear engineering or gas pipeline transmission), and those whose responsibilities are more general and do not require such specialized knowledge (such as business, finance, and other corporate support functions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We then attempt to match to the greatest degree possible our positions with similar positions in the survey results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We may blend the survey results to achieve what we believe is an appropriate comparison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also use performance data covering a larger peer group of utilities in determining long-term equity incentive compensation under our shareholder approved Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan, as discussed under Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to considering market survey comparisons, we consider each senior executive officers knowledge, skills, scope of authority and responsibilities, job performance and tenure with us as a senior executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marsh has been our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer since December 2011, and he has also served as our President and Chief Operating Officer since January 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to January 2011, he served as our Senior Vice President from 1998 to January 2011, and as our Chief Financial Officer from 1996 to April 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He previously served as President of South Carolina Electric & Gas Company (SCE&G), our largest subsidiary from April 2006 to November 2011, and as SCE&Gs Chief Operating Officer from April 2006 to January 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marsh previously practiced as a certified public accountant and has been with us for over 30 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As our Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Marsh is responsible for strategic planning, development of our senior executive officers and oversight of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Addison was appointed Executive Vice President of SCANA in January 2012, and he has served as our Chief Financial Officer since April 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in May 2014, Mr. Addison was appointed President and Chief Operating Officer of our subsidiary, SCANA Energy Marketing, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to January 2012, Mr. Addison had served as a Senior Vice President of SCANA since 2006 and Vice President of Finance from 2001 to 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Chief Financial Officer, he is responsible for all of our financial operations, including accounting, treasury, shareholder and investor relations, taxation and financial planning, and until November of 2016, he was responsible for senior oversight of our information technology functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Addison is also a certified public accountant and has been with us for more than 25 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Byrne is an Executive Vice President of SCANA, as well as President of Generation and Transmission and Chief Operating Officer of SCE&G.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these positions he is responsible for overseeing a diversified fleet of coal, natural gas, hydro, nuclear and renewable generating facilities as well as the operation and planning of our high voltage transmission system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: His nuclear responsibilities include overseeing the construction of our two new nuclear units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was previously our Chief Nuclear Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a degreed engineer with over 30 years of utility experience and has held a Nuclear Regulatory Commission Senior Reactor Operators license.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Byrne has been with us for over 20 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lindsay is a Senior Vice President and the General Counsel of SCANA and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is responsible for oversight of all legal, legal regulatory, environmental, and corporate secretary functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lindsay has been with us for 8 years and has more than 40 years experience as an attorney, which includes more than 25 years serving in a General Counsel role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kissam is a Senior Vice President of SCANA, as well as the President of Retail Operations for SCE&G.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these positions he is responsible for providing leadership and strategic planning for the safe and reliable construction, maintenance, and operations of our electric transmission and distribution systems.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also oversees the Companys renewable energy initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kissam has been with us for 29 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Factors Considered
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the foregoing information, we consider the fairness of the compensation paid to each senior executive officer in relation to what we pay our other senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee also considers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: recommendations from our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer in setting compensation for senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We review our compensation program and levels of compensation paid to all of our senior executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers, annually and may make adjustments based on the foregoing factors as well as other subjective factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our Compensation Committee reviewed summaries of compensation components (tally sheets) for all of our senior executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These tally sheets reflect changes in compensation during the prior year, if any, and affix dollar amounts to each component of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Committee did not make any adjustments to executive compensation in 2016 based solely on its review of the tally sheets, it intends to continue to use such tally sheets in the future to review each component of the total compensation package, including base salaries, short- and long-term incentives, severance plans, insurance, retirement and other benefits, as a factor in determining the total compensation package for each senior executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not have a practice of adjusting the size of current and future compensation awards or compensation program components to reflect amounts realized or unrealized by an individual from prior equity grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In other words, awards are not increased to compensate for prior performance below target, nor are they decreased because of prior performance above target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Likewise, since earnings on equity compensation are not included in any pension calculation formula, any gains, or lack thereof, from prior awards are not considered in setting or earning retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Timing of Senior Executive Officer Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual salary reviews are routinely conducted and any adjustments are made, and short- and long-term incentive compensation awards are routinely granted in February of each year at the first regularly scheduled Compensation Committee and Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determinations are also made at those meetings as to whether to pay out awards under the most recently completed cycle of short- and long-term incentive compensation (which include equity based incentive compensation).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation determinations also may be made by the Committee at its other quarterly meetings in the case of newly hired executives, employee promotions, or adjustments of existing employees compensation that could not be deferred until the February meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We routinely release our annual and quarterly earnings information to the public in conjunction with the quarterly meetings of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior executive officer base salaries are divided into grade levels based on market data for similar positions, experience and certain internal equity considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes it is appropriate to set base salaries at a reasonable level that will provide executives with a predictable income base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, base salaries are targeted at the median (50  percentile) of the market survey data with the exception of Mr. Marshs salary, which is targeted at the 75  percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews base salaries annually and makes adjustments, if appropriate, on the basis of an assessment of individual performance, relative levels of accountability, prior experience, breadth and depth of knowledge, specialized talent required for new operational initiatives, changes in market compensation practices as reflected in market survey data, and relative compensation levels within our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the Named Executive Officers received base salary increases in the following percentages: Mr. Marsh, 5%; Mr. Addison, 5%; Mr. Byrne, 5%; Mr. Lindsay, 3%; and Mr. Kissam, 4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such increases were based on individual performance and the degree to which the Named Executive Officers base salaries were below the market rate for their positions and certain internal equity considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term and Long-Term Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior executive officer compensation program provides for both short-term incentive compensation in the form of annual cash incentive compensation, and long-term equity-based incentive compensation payable at the end of periods which have historically lasted three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both our Short-Term Annual Incentive and Long-Term Equity Compensation Plans promote our pay-for-performance philosophy, as well as our goal of having a meaningful amount of pay at-risk, and we believe both plans provide us a competitive advantage in recruiting and retaining top quality talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan provides our senior executive officers with an annual stimulus to achieve short-term individual and business unit or departmental goals and short-term corporate earnings goals that ultimately help us achieve our long-term corporate goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan counterbalances the emphasis of short-term incentive compensation on short-term results by focusing our senior executive officers on achievement of our long-term corporate goals, providing additional incentives for them to remain our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employees by ensuring that they have a continuing stake in the long-term success of the Company, and significantly aligning the interests of senior executive officers with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015 Changes to Short-Term and Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the Companys 2015 and 2016 Proxy Statements, in July of 2014, our Compensation Committee asked management to engage its compensation consultant, Willis Towers Watson, to review our short-term annual incentive and our long-term equity compensation practices for comparability to executive compensation practices of our utility and general industry peers and general compensation best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, Willis Towers Watson concluded that our executive compensation practices were generally in line with our peers, with a few exceptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviewed these exceptions, and recommended to the Board a number of changes for the executive compensation awards to be granted in 2015 from the awards granted over the past several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Willis Towers Watson advised management that these changes would bring our practices more in line with our peers and current market practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes, which were implemented in 2015, included revising short-term annual incentive awards to equalize weighting of earnings per share goals and individual goals and to reduce the amount of discretionary award that can be paid, and revising long-term equity compensation awards to change the measurement of the performance cycles, increase the maximum payout, and change the mix of performance shares and restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the 2014-2016 Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plan awards were granted in February 2014, prior to implementation of the changes, the changes are not reflected in those awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan provides financial incentives for performance in the form of opportunities for annual incentive cash payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants in the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan currently include not only our senior executive officers, but also approximately 250 additional employees, including other officers, senior management, division heads and other professionals whose positions or levels of responsibility make their participation in the Plan appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Chief Executive Officer recommends, and the Compensation Committee approves, the performance measures, operational goals and other terms and conditions of incentive awards for senior executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers, except the Chief Executive Officer, for whom such determinations are made by the Committee along with the other independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves target short-term incentive awards at its first regularly scheduled meeting each year based on percentages assigned to each executive salary grade.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts of actual short-term incentive awards are based both on the Companys achieving pre- determined earnings per share goals in the coming year, and on each senior executive officers level of performance in achieving his or her individual and business unit financial and strategic objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee selected these performance metrics because it believes they are key measures of financial and operational success, and that achieving our earnings and strategic goals supports the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In assessing accomplishment of objectives, the Committee considers the difficulty of achieving each objective, unforeseen obstacles or favorable circumstances that might have altered the level of difficulty in achieving the objective, overall importance of the objective to our long-term and short-term goals, and importance of achieving the objective to enhancing shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in annual target short-term incentive awards can be made if there are changes in the senior executive officers salary grade level or a change in the competitive market target that warrant a target change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the awards under the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan provided that:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of the target annual cash incentive award would be earned based on the extent to which we met designated earnings per share goals; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% of the target award would be earned based on our Named Executive Officers and the other participants achieving individual and business unit performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed and approved all senior executive officer individual and business unit objectives, and the Committee, along with the other independent directors, approved the Chief Executive Officers individual and business unit objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts of awards are scaled based on the levels at which these goals are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan further provided that, if we exceeded our earnings per share goals, payouts of up to 130% of the target awards could be earned, which would also be scaled based on the extent to which we exceeded such earnings per share goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Above Target Awards Earned Based on Exceeding the Earnings per Share Goals of the 2016 Annual Incentive Award beginning on page 32.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan also allows discretionary awards up to 20% of target awards, not to exceed a total award of 150% of target for any participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Discretionary Bonus Awards beginning on page 33.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The estimated possible payouts that could have been earned under the 2016 Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan if performance objectives were met at threshold, target and maximum levels are set forth in the 2016 Grants of Plan-Based Awards table on page 43 under the columns beneath the caption Estimated Possible Payouts under Non-Equity Incentive Plan Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 payouts under the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan based on our achieving our earnings per share goal, and our Named Executive Officers achieving their individual and business unit objectives, are reflected in the Summary Compensation Table on page 42, under the column Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings per Share Component of the 2016 Annual Incentive Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Up to 50% of the total 2016 annual incentive award could be earned based on the extent to which we met our earnings per share goals as set forth below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our actual earnings per share for 2016 were $4.16, which resulted in our senior executive officers, and the other participants in the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan, earning 100% on the 50% of the earnings per share component of the 2016 annual incentive award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Strategic Objectives Component of 2016 Annual Incentive Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remaining 50% of the 2016 annual incentive award was based on our senior executive officers level of performance in helping us achieve our annual business objectives by achieving their individual and business unit performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our Named Executive Officers achieved all of heir individual and business unit financial and strategic objectives in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, our Named Executive Officers earned 100% on the 50% portion of the annual incentive award based on individual and business unit performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual Strategic Objectives on which 2016 Annual Incentive Awards were Based
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our Named Executive Officers were responsible for specific financial metrics to support the Companys earnings per share goals as well as prioritization of actions under, and commencing implementation of, plans to support the Companys workforce diversity objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, each Named Executive Officer was required to contribute to the Companys objective to meet an earnings per share growth target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The financial metric also required the identification of additional pre-tax income for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the common goals as set forth above, the individual and business unit strategic objectives the Compensation Committee considered in determining short-term incentive awards for the Named Executive Officers were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Marshs award was based on his oversight and support of our new nuclear construction activities, as well as providing leadership to senior executive officers to ensure successful completion of major 2016 corporate initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Addisons award was based on his efforts to secure financing related to our new nuclear construction project; completing an evaluation of pricing options under the amended Engineering, Procurement and Construction Agreement relating to our new nuclear construction, and overseeing regulatory approval of additional costs associated with the selected option; and evaluating, in consultation with external advisors and credit rating agencies, the benefit of various tax initiatives, and based on the evaluation, the implementation of appropriate initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Byrnes award was based on his continuing oversight of various aspects of our new nuclear construction activities; completing an evaluation of pricing options under the amended Engineering, Procurement and Construction Agreement relating to our new nuclear construction, and overseeing regulatory approval of additional costs associated with the selected option; and obtaining a long-term coal ash sale agreement and regulatory approvals in connection therewith.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lindsays award was based on his oversight of our sustainability efforts as articulated in our Environmental Sustainability Report; his involvement in implementation of the amended Engineering, Procurement and Construction Agreement relating to our new nuclear construction and establishment of a Dispute Resolution Board to resolve pricing disputes under the agreement; and his involvement in our response to proposed environmental regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kissams award was based on his oversight of our achieving specific safety and customer reliability goals for electric operations; developing and overseeing completion of our new nuclear transmission construction milestones; and developing and providing executive leadership for the implementation of a comprehensive community outreach plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Above Target Awards Earned Based on Exceeding the Earnings per Share Goals of the 2016 Annual Incentive Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the foregoing sections, all of our Named Executive Officers earned 100% of their target awards under the 2016 Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan, based 50% on our achieving our earnings per share goals and 50% on their meeting individual and business unit objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the 50% of the awards earned based on earnings per share and the 50% of the awards earned based on results of individual and business unit strategic objectives, our 2016 Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan provided that awards of up to 130% of target could be earned if earning per share goals exceeded the target of $4.00 as set forth below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our actual earnings per share for 2016 were $4.16, which resulted in our senior executive officers, and the other participants in the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan, earning 130% of target awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary Bonus Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan also allows for discretionary awards as may be recommended by our Compensation Committee and approved by our full Board (or all independent directors in the case of the Chief Executive Officer) up to 20% of target awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The discretion may be applied for all or for individual participants, but no participants award may exceed 150% of the participants target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board also has the discretion to decrease any or all awards made pursuant to the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our Board did not make any discretionary awards, or decrease any awards, to any Named Executive Officers in the Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The potential value of long-term equity-based incentive compensation opportunities comprises a significant portion of the total compensation package for senior executive officers and key employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that emphasizing this component of total compensation provides the appropriate long-range focus for senior executive officers and other key employees who are charged with responsibility for managing the Company and achieving success for our shareholders because it links the amount of their compensation to our long-term business and financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A portion of each senior executive officers potential compensation consists of awards under the Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The types of long-term equity-based compensation the Compensation Committee may award under the Plan include incentive and non-qualified stock options, stock appreciation rights (either alone or in tandem with a related stock option), restricted stock, restricted stock units, performance units and performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, our long-term equity-based awards have been in the form of performance shares and restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These long-term equity-based awards are granted subject to satisfaction of specific performance goals and vesting schedules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 performance period, awards under the Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan consisted of 80% performance shares and 20% restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015-2017 and 2016-2018 performance periods, awards under the Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan consisted of 70% performance shares and 30% restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has not awarded stock options since 2002 and has no plans to do so in the foreseeable future, and the Committee has not awarded any stock appreciation rights under the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe awards of performance shares align the interests of our executives with those of shareholders because the value of such awards is tied to our achieving financial and business goals that would be expected to affect the value of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe awards of restricted stock units align the interests of our executives with those of shareholders in that they ensure a long-term view of success, and we believe the three-year vesting schedule aids in retention of executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although restricted stock units do not have the same risk of forfeiture for failure to meet performance thresholds associated with performance shares, they have no upside potential for payout above target level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For several years prior to 2015, the Compensation Committee granted performance share awards that were earned, if at all, over a three-year period measured in three one-year cycles based on comparative Total Shareholder Return (TSR) and earnings per share growth components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with grants made in February 2015, however, the three-year periods are measured in a single three-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards based on these components place a portion of executive compensation at risk because executives are compensated pursuant to the awards only when the objectives for TSR and earnings growth are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, comparing our TSR to the TSR of a group of other companies reflects our recognition that investors could have invested their funds in other entities and measures how well we performed over time when compared to others in the group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards are denominated in shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of target performance shares into which awards are denominated is calculated by multiplying the Named Executive Officers base salary by a target percentage based on positions cited in the market survey data and dividing the product by a valuation factor applied to our opening stock price on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The target percentage is derived from market survey data of the peer companies listed above under Factors Considered in Setting Senior Executive Officer Compensation  Use of Market Surveys and Peer Group Data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The valuation factor is provided to us by managements compensation consultant and is intended as a means to establish a grant date salary equivalent value that takes into consideration such factors as dividend treatment,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and potential for maximum performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards may be paid in stock or cash or a combination of stock and cash at the Committees discretion, but are most frequently paid in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, all payouts have been in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts are based on the closing market price of our stock on the last business day of the three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance share awards accrue dividend equivalents prior to vesting, which are paid at vesting based on the level at which the awards are earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014-2016 Performance Share and Restricted Stock Unit Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 period, we granted awards under the Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan to each of the Named Executive Officers comprised of a combination of 80% performance shares and 20% restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of 2014-2016 Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2014-2016 period, the components on which we based performance share awards to senior executive officers were as follows: (1) one half to be earned based on our level of achieving TSR relative to the TSR of a peer group of companies; and (2) remaining one half to be earned based on our level of achieving growth in GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TSR over each of the one-year performance periods was equal to the change in our common stock price, plus cash dividends paid on our common stock during the period, divided by the common stock price as of the beginning of the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance measurement and award determinations for the performance shares for the 2014-2016 period were made on an annual basis with vesting and payment of awards being deferred until after the end of the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, payouts under the 2014-2016 three-year period were earned for each year that performance goals were met during the three-year period, but vesting and payment were deferred until the end of the three-year period and were contingent upon the participant still being employed with us at the end of the three-year period, subject to certain exceptions in the event of retirement, death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts would also have been accelerated in the event of certain change in control events.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See   Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Criteria for the 2014-2016 Performance Share Awards and Earned and Vested Awards for the 2014-2016 Performance Period
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the half of the 2014-2016 performance share awards based on the TSR component, payouts were scaled according to our ranking against a peer group of utilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives could earn threshold payouts (equal to 25% of target award) for each year of the three-year period in which we ranked at the 25  percentile in relation to the peer groups TSR performance for the one-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target payouts (equal to 100% of target award) could be earned for each year of the three-year period in which we ranked at the 50  percentile in relation to the peer groups TSR performance for the one-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maximum payouts (equal to 175% of target award) could be earned for each year of the three-year period in which our performance ranked at or above the 90  percentile in relation to the peer groups TSR performance for the one-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts were scaled between 25% and 175% of target based on the actual percentile achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payout could be earned if our performance was less than the 25  percentile, and no payouts could exceed 175% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold, target and maximum payouts at the 25 , 50  and 90  percentiles were used because these generally matched the levels used by the companies in the market survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th th th th th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share, and GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share, as used throughout this proxy statement, are synonymous terms that we have used over time in our periodic reports and external communications to refer to the same non-GAAP financial measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that this non-GAAP financial measure provides a consistent basis upon which to measure performance from year to year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The measure has historically excluded from earnings such items as the effects arising from abnormal weather, the Companys adoption of new accounting guidance, the favorable settlement of certain litigation, and the effects of sales of certain investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management uses this measure when determining earnings guidance and growth projections and uses the measure in part in making budgetary and operational decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2014, our GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share of $3.58 were lower than our GAAP net earnings per share of $3.79 due to the exclusion of $0.21 ($0.31 pre-tax less a tax effect of $0.10) attributable to the effects of abnormal weather in the Companys electric business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2015, our GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings of $3.73 were lower than our GAAP net earnings per share of $5.22 due to the exclusion of $1.41 ($2.39 pre-tax less a tax effect of $0.98) attributable to the sales of two subsidiaries and $0.08 ($0.12 pre-tax less a tax effect of $0.04) attributable to the effects of abnormal weather in the Companys electric business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our GAAP- adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share of $3.97 were lower than our GAAP net earnings per share of $4.16 due to the exclusion of $0.19 ($0.28 pre-tax less a tax effect of $0.09) attributable to the effects of abnormal weather in the Companys electric business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of utilities included in the peer group used for TSR comparisons is larger than the number included in the market survey utility peer group we use for purposes of setting base salary and short- and long-term incentive targets because information about TSR is publicly available for a larger number of utilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We include only utilities in the TSR peer group because we have assumed that shareholders would measure our performance against performance of other utilities in which they might have invested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the first, second and third years of the 2014-2016 performance period, our TSR was at the 61 , 82 , and 75  percentiles, which resulted in 121% being earned on the TSR component for the first year, 160% being earned for the second year, and 147% for the third year, vesting and payment of which were deferred until the end of the three-year period as discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall payout of the TSR portion of the performance shares, which occurred in February 2017, was 142.67%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: st nd th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the half of performance shares based on our level of achieving growth in GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share targets, executives could earn threshold payouts (equal to 25% of target award) for each year in the three-year period in which growth in GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share equaled 1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives could earn target payouts (equal to 100% of target award) for each year in which such growth equaled 4.5%, and maximum payouts (equal to 175% of target award) for each year in which such growth equaled or exceeded 8%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential payouts were scaled between 25% and 175% based on the actual growth in GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payouts could be earned for any year in which growth in GAAP- adjusted net earnings per share was less than 1%, and no payouts could exceed 175% of target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the first, second and third years of the 2014-2016 period, our growth in GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share was 5.3%,4.2%, and 6.4%, respectively (11.5%, 37.7% and 20.3% respectively, in GAAP net earnings per share (see footnote 1 on page 34 for a reconciliation of our GAAP- adjusted net earnings per share to our GAAP net earnings per share)), which resulted in 117.1%, 93.6%, and 140.7% awards on the earnings per share component being earned for the first, second and third years, respectively, vesting and payment of which were deferred until the end of the three-year period as discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall payout of the GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share portion of the performance shares, which occurred in February 2017, was 117.13%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The overall payout of the total TSR and GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share components of the performance share awards for the 2014-2016 cycle, which occurred in February 2017, was 129.9%, and is reflected in the 2016 Option Exercises and Stock Vested table on page 45.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2014-2016 Restricted Stock Unit Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2014-2016 restricted stock unit awards were granted on February 20, 2014, and were based on the fair market value of our common stock on the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock units were subject to a three-year vesting period, and were not performance based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock units did not have voting rights prior to vesting, and were subject to forfeiture in the event of termination of employment prior to the end of the vesting period, subject to exceptions for retirement, death, disability, or change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock units accrue dividend equivalents prior to vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information about vesting of the restricted stock unit award component of the 2014-2016 awards is reflected in the 2016 Option Exercises and Stock Vested table on page 45.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The restricted stock units were paid in cash in February 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2015-2017 Performance Share and Restricted Stock Unit Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, in 2015 the Compensation Committee recommended, and the Board approved, a number of changes to our long-term incentive compensation practices to better align them with peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These changes included revising long-term equity compensation awards to change the measurement of performance cycles, increase the maximum payout, and change the mix of performance shares and restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015-2017 period, we changed the mix of awards granted under the Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan to each of the Named Executive Officers from a combination of 80% performance shares and 20% restricted stock units to a combination of 70% performance shares and 30% restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Components of 2015-2017 Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The components on which we based the 2015-2017 performance share awards were as follows: (1) one half to be earned based on our level of achieving TSR relative to the TSR of a peer group of companies; and (2) the remaining one half to be earned based on our level of achieving average growth in GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share targets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using a 20 trading day average prior to the start and end of the performance period, the TSR over the performance period will be equal to the change in our common stock price, plus cash dividends paid on our common stock during the period, divided by the common stock price as of the beginning of the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unlike the 2014-2016 performance share awards, performance measurement and award determination for the performance shares for the 2015-2017 period will be made for the entire three- year cycle with vesting and payment of awards after the end of the three-year cycle, instead of performance measurement and award determination being made on an annual basis with vesting and payment of awards being deferred until after the end of the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Criteria for the 2015-2017 Performance Share Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts based on the TSR component of the 2015-2017 performance share awards will be scaled according to our ranking against the same peer group of utilities used for the 2014-2016 period as discussed above under Performance Criteria for the 2014-2016 Performance Share Awards and Earned and Vested Awards for the 2014-2016 Performance Period, unless a company could no longer be included due to a merger, dissolution or other similar transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives can earn threshold payouts (equal to 25% of target award) if our TSR for the entire three-year period ranks at the 25  percentile in relation to the peer groups TSR performance for the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target payouts (equal to 100% of target award) can be earned if our TSR for the entire three-year period ranks at the 50  percentile in relation to the peer groups TSR performance for the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maximum payouts (equal to 200% of target award) can be earned if our TSR for the entire three-year period ranks at or above the 90  percentile in relation to the peer groups performance for the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts will be scaled between 25% and 200% based on the actual percentile achieved for the three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payout can be earned if our performance over the three-year period is less than the 25  percentile, and no payout can exceed 200% of the target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Threshold, target and maximum payouts at the 25 , 50  and 90  percentiles were used because these generally matched the levels used by the companies in the market survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: th th th th th th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the half of performance shares based on our level of achieving growth in GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share targets, we will determine the growth achieved by calculating GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share for each year in the three-year period and averaging the amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives can earn threshold payouts (equal to 25% of target award) if for the three-year period, average annual growth in GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share equals 1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives can earn target payouts (equal to 100% of target award) if for the three-year period, such average annual growth equals 4.5%, and maximum payouts (equal to 200% of target award) if for the three-year period, such average annual growth equals or exceeds 8%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential payouts will be scaled between 25% and 200% based on the actual average growth in GAAP- adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share for the entire three-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payouts can be earned if growth in GAAP-adjusted weather- normalized net earnings per share is less than 1% for the three-year period, and no payouts can exceed 200% of target award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like the 2015-2017 performance share awards, performance measurement and award determination for the performance shares for the 2016-2018 period will be made for the entire three-year cycle with vesting and payment of awards after the end of the three-year cycle.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the half of performance shares based on our level of achieving growth in GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share targets, we will determine the growth achieved by calculating GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share for each year in the three-year period and averaging the amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives can earn threshold payouts (equal to 25% of target award) if for the three-year period, average annual growth in GAAP-adjusted weather-normalized net earnings per share equals 1%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives can earn target payouts (equal to 100% of target award) if for the three-year period, such average annual growth equals 5%, and maximum payouts (equal to 200% of target award) if for the three-year period, such average annual growth equals or exceeds 9%.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At its February 2017 meeting, the Board, on recommendation of the Compensation Committee, increased the base salaries of Messrs. Marsh (4%), Addison (4%), Byrne (4%), Kissam (4%), and Lindsay (3%).

sentences.text: The salary adjustments will not result in compensation materially different from 2016 compensation.

sentences.text: Retirement and Other Benefit Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We currently sponsor the following retirement benefit plans:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A tax qualified defined benefit retirement plan (the Retirement Plan) (closed to new employees and rehired employees as of December 31, 2013);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A nonqualified defined benefit Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan (the SERP) (closed to new employees and rehired employees as of December 31, 2013);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A tax qualified defined contribution plan (the 401(k) Plan also known as the SCANA Corporation 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A nonqualified defined contribution Executive Deferred Compensation Plan (the EDCP)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees who have met eligibility requirements may participate in the Retirement Plan and the 401(k) Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP and the EDCP are designed to provide a benefit to senior executive officers who participate in the Retirement Plan or 401(k) Plan (our tax qualified retirement plans) and whose participation in those tax qualified plans at the same percentage of salary as all other employees is otherwise limited by government regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP and EDCP participants are provided with the benefits to which they would have been entitled under the Retirement Plan or 401(k) Plan had their participation not been limited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At present, certain senior executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers, are participants in the SERP and/or EDCP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP is described under the caption Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control  Retirement Benefits  Supplemental Executive Retirement Plan on page 52 and the EDCP is described under the caption 2016 Nonqualified Deferred Compensation  Executive Deferred Compensation Plan on page 47.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide the SERP and the EDCP benefits because they allow our senior executive officers the opportunity to defer the same percentage of their compensation as other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe, based on market survey data, that these plans may be necessary to make our senior executive officer retirement benefits competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2013, the Retirement Plan and the SERP were both closed to new employees and rehired employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current participants in the Retirement Plan and the SERP who continue to meet eligibility requirements will continue to earn benefits until December 31, 2023.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2024, participants will no longer earn any future benefit accruals under these plans except that participants under the cash balance formula will continue to earn interest credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide other benefits such as medical, dental, life and disability insurance, which are available to all of our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we provide our executive officers with additional long-term disability insurance and retiree medical and term life insurance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination, Severance and Change in Control Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our retirement and benefit plans include provisions that provide for payments to our senior executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers, in the event of a change in control of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These arrangements, including the triggering events for payments and possible payment amounts, are described under the caption Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that these arrangements are not uncommon for executives at the level of our Named Executive Officers and senior executive officer participants, including executives of the companies included in our compensation market survey information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe these arrangements are important factors in attracting and retaining our senior executive officers by assuring them financial and employment status protections in the event control of our Company changes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe such assurances of financial and employment protections help free executives from personal concerns over their futures, and thereby, can help to align their interests more closely with those of shareholders in negotiating transactions that could result in a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Conten
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide limited perquisites to senior executive officers as summarized below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Aircraft
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company leases two aircraft for the use of officers and managers in their travels to various operations throughout our service areas, as well as to meet with regulatory bodies, industry groups, financial groups, and to conduct other Company business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our senior executive officers may use the aircraft for business purposes on a non-exclusive basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aircraft may also be used to transport directors to and from meetings and committee meetings of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Spouses or close family members of directors and senior executive officers occasionally accompany a director or senior executive officer on the aircraft when the director or executive officer is flying for our business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On rare occasions, a senior executive officer may use the aircraft for personal use that is not in connection with a business purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We impute income to the executive for certain expenses related to such use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of determining total 2016 compensation, we valued the aggregate incremental cost of the personal use of our aircraft, if any, using a method that takes into account the variable expenses associated with operating the aircraft, which variable expenses are only incurred if the planes are flying.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following items are included in our aggregate incremental cost: aircraft fuel and oil expenses per hour of flight; maintenance, parts and external labor (inspections and repairs) per hour of flight; landing/parking/flight planning services expenses; crew travel expenses; supplies and food.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Medical Examinations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer all employees who participate in our health plans a preventive annual medical examination at no cost.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, in order that we might plan for any executive-level health related retirements or resignations, we also provide each of our senior executive officers the opportunity to have a comprehensive annual medical examination from Lexington Medical Center, or the physician of his or her choice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Security Systems
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer installation and monitoring of home security systems for our senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because we operate a nuclear facility and provide essential services to the public, we believe we have a duty to help assure uninterrupted and safe operations by protecting the safety and security of our senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide such installation and monitoring at more than one home for some senior executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide a taxable allowance to our senior executive officers for financial counseling services, including tax preparation and estate planning services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value this benefit based on the actual charges incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also pay the fees and monthly dues for club memberships for senior executive officers which are used for business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We sometimes invite spouses to accompany directors and senior executive officers to our quarterly Board meetings because we believe social gatherings of directors and senior executive officers in connection with these meetings increases collegiality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting and Tax Treatment of Compensation and Effect of Financial Restatement on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deductibility of Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code establishes a limit on the tax deductibility of annual compensation in excess of $1,000,000 for certain senior executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain performance-based compensation approved by shareholders is not subject to the tax deduction limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Long-Term Equity Compensation Plan is currently qualified so that most performance-based awards under that Plan constitute compensation that is not subject to Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Short-Term Annual Incentive Plan does not meet Section 162(m) tax deductibility requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To maintain flexibility in compensating senior executive officers in a manner designed to promote various corporate goals, the Compensation Committee has not adopted a policy that all compensation must be tax deductible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because Mr. Marshs salary exceeds the $1,000,000 threshold, we may not deduct a portion of his compensation for tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
