sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5  APPROVAL OF BOARD-PROPOSED AMENDMENTS TO ARTICLE 8 OF OUR ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION TO DECLASSIFY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND PROVIDE FOR THE ANNUAL ELECTION OF ALL DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background of the Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Articles of Incorporation currently provide for a classified Board of Directors divided into three classes, with each class being elected for a three- year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012 and 2013, we received shareholder proposals recommending the declassification of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, 38% of our outstanding shares voted in favor of the proposal, and in 2013, 44% of our outstanding shares voted in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also received a shareholder proposal for our 2014 Annual Meeting seeking a shareholder vote on declassification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of the apparent growing shareholder support for declassification, the Board proposed amendments to our Articles of Incorporation to effect declassification and recommended that our shareholders approve such amendments at the 2014 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our agreement to submit a Board proposal on declassification to shareholders, the shareholder proposal for the 2014 Annual Meeting was withdrawn.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We resubmitted a Board declassification proposal at each of the 2015 and 2016 Annual Meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2014, 2015 and 2016 Annual Meetings, 62%, 63% and 64%, respectively, of our outstanding shares voted in favor of the proposal, but shareholder support is still significantly less than the 80% affirmative vote of outstanding shares required to adopt the amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is committed to strong corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering the results of the shareholder votes on the 2012  2016 proposals, as well as the support of institutional investor groups for annual election of directors, the Board again took into account the advantages and disadvantages of a classified Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In favor of retaining the classified board structure, the Board noted that: a classified board structure provides valuable stability and continuity of leadership; a classified board structure enables us to recruit high quality directors who are willing to invest the time and energy necessary to understand our business, technology, competitive environment and strategic goals; and a classified board structure helps protect shareholder value in case of an unsolicited takeover proposal at an unfair price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In favor of declassification, the Board noted that declassification would allow our shareholders to evaluate all directors annually and would be consistent with a view that a declassified board is a corporate governance best practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considered that many U.S. public companies have eliminated their classified board structures in recent years based on the perception of a growing number of investors that annual election of directors is the primary means for shareholders to influence corporate governance policies and to increase board accountability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2017, the Board decided to again propose amendments to Article 8 of our Articles of Incorporation to declassify the Board and provide for the annual election of all directors, and to recommend that our shareholders vote in favor of the amendments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposed Amendments to Article 8 of the Articles of Incorporation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the proposed amendments, the annual election of directors would be phased in gradually to assure a smooth transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the amendments are adopted, they would become effective upon our filing of Articles of Amendment with the South Carolina Secretary of State following the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, directors elected at the 2018 annual meeting and thereafter would be elected to one-year terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our Articles of Incorporation as in effect for the 2017 Annual Meeting, directors to be elected at the 2017 Annual Meeting will be elected to serve three-year terms, expiring at the 2020 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who were elected at the 2016 annual meeting will continue to serve their current terms until the 2019 annual meeting, and directors who were elected at the 2015 annual meeting will continue to serve their current terms until the 2018 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Article 8 of our Articles of Incorporation would also be amended to delete other references to classification of the Board and to provide that a director elected to fill a newly created directorship or vacancy would serve until the next annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the proposed amendments to Article 8 of our Articles of Incorporation are not adopted by shareholders, the Board of Directors will remain classified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Text of the Proposed Amendments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The text of the proposed amendments to our Articles of Incorporation is as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of directors of the corporation that shall constitute the entire Board of Directors shall be fixed from time to time by or pursuant to the provisions of the By-laws of the corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such provision shall continue in effect unless and until changed by the Board of Directors, but no such changes shall affect the term of any director then in office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the adoption of this Section 8.A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: , Directors elected prior to the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders shall continue to be, and are, divided into three classes (I, II and III), as nearly equal in number as possible, and shall hold office for a term expiring at the annual meeting of shareholders held in the third year following the year of their respective elections and until their respective successors are elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors elected at each annual meeting of shareholders commencing with the annual meeting of shareholders in 2018 shall hold office for a term of one year expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their respective successors are duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No person who is not a salaried employee of the corporation who would attain the age of 70 or older during his term of service as a director shall be eligible to be elected a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No person who is a salaried employee of the corporation who is age 65 or older shall be eligible to be elected a director, and the term of office of any director who is a salaried employee of the corporation shall expire upon such director attaining the age of 65 or upon retirement from active service with the corporation, whichever is earlier; provided, however, a person who is the Chief Executive Officer shall be eligible for election as a director even if such person is age 65 or older or has retired from active service with the corporation, and such persons term shall not expire as a result of attaining age 65 or prior retirement from active service with the corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: B. Newly created directorships resulting from any increase in the authorized number of directors or any vacancies in the Board of Directors resulting from death, resignation, retirement, disqualification, removal from office or any other cause shall be filled only by the Board of Directors then in office, although less than a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors elected to fill a newly created directorship or other vacancies shall hold office until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until such directors successor has been elected and has qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: C. No changes to Article 8.C.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: D. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if at any time the holders of any one or more classes or series of preferred stock issued by the corporation shall have the right, voting separately by class or series, to elect directors at an annual or special meeting of stockholders, the election, term of office, filling of vacancies and other features of such directorships shall be governed by the terms of these Restated Articles of Incorporation applicable thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Required Vote and Board Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Articles of Incorporation require that, to be adopted, the proposed amendments must be approved by the affirmative vote of at least 80% of all outstanding shares of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If approved, the amendments will become effective upon filing of Articles of Amendment with the Secretary of State of South Carolina.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Statements included in this Financial Appendix (or elsewhere herein) which are not statements of historical fact are intended to be, and are hereby identified as, forward-looking statements for purposes of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, statements concerning key earnings drivers, customer growth, environmental regulations and expenditures, leverage ratio, projections for pension fund contributions, financing activities, access to sources of capital, impacts of the adoption of new accounting rules and estimated construction and other expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In some cases, forward-looking statements can be identified by terminology such as may, will, could, should, expects, forecasts, plans, anticipates, believes, estimates, projects, predicts, potential or continue or the negative of these terms or other similar terminology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Readers are cautioned that any such forward- looking statements are not guarantees of future performance and involve a number of risks and uncertainties, and that actual results could differ materially from those indicated by such forward-looking statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those indicated by such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) the information is of a preliminary nature and may be subject to further and/or continuing review and adjustment;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) current and future litigation; (4) changes in the economy, especially in areas served by subsidiaries of SCANA;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) the impact of conservation and demand side management efforts and/or technological advances on customer usage; (7) the loss of sales to distributed generation, such as solar photovoltaic systems or energy storage systems;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (9) the results of short- and long-term financing efforts, including prospects for obtaining access to capital markets and other sources of liquidity; (10) the effects of weather, especially in areas where the generation and transmission facilities of SCANA and its subsidiaries (the Company) are located and in areas served by SCANAs subsidiaries;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (13) the results of efforts to license, site, construct and finance facilities for electric generation and transmission, including nuclear generating facilities (14) the results of efforts to operate the Companys electric and gas systems and assets in accordance with acceptable performance standards, including the impact of additional distributed generation and nuclear generation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (15) maintaining creditworthy joint owners for SCE&Gs new nuclear generation project; (16) the creditworthiness and/or financial stability of contractors for SCE&Gs new nuclear generation project, particularly in light of adverse financial developments disclosed by Toshiba;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (19) the availability of fuels such as coal, natural gas and enriched uranium used to produce electricity; the availability of purchased power and natura gas for distribution; the level and volatility of future market prices for such fuels and purchased power; and the ability to recover the costs for such fuels and purchased power;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (20) the availability of skilled, licensed and experienced human resources to properly manage, operate, and grow the Companys businesses; (21) labor disputes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (22) performance of SCANAs pension plan assets and the effect(s) of associated discount rates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANAS BUSINESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA is a South Carolina corporation created in 1984 as a holding company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA and its subsidiaries had full-time, permanent employees of 5,910 as of February 20, 2017 and 5,829 as of February 19, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA does not directly own or operate any significant physical properties, but it holds directly all of the capital stock of its subsidiaries described below, each of which is incorporated in South Carolina.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulated Utilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G is engaged in the generation, transmission, distribution and sale of electricity to approximately 709,000 customers and the purchase, sale and transportation of natural gas to approximately 358,000 customers (each as of December 31, 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs business experiences seasonal fluctuations, with generally higher sales of electricity during the summer and winter months because of air conditioning and heating requirements, and generally higher sales of natural gas during the winter months due to heating requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs electric service territory extends into 24 counties covering nearly 16,000 square miles in the central, southern and southwestern portions of South Carolina.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The service area for natural gas encompasses all or part of 35 counties in South Carolina and covers approximately 23,000 square miles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 3.4 million persons live in the counties where SCE&G conducts its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resale customers include municipalities, electric cooperatives, other investor-owned utilities, registered marketers and federal and state electric agencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Predominant industries served by SCE&G include chemicals, educational services, paper products, food products, lumber and wood products, health services, textile manufacturing, rubber and miscellaneous plastic products, automotive and tire and fabricated metal products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENCO owns Williams Station and sells electricity, pursuant to a FERC-approved tariff, solely to SCE&G under the terms of a unit power sales agreement and related operating agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fuel Company acquires, owns and provides financing for SCE&Gs nuclear fuel, certain fossil fuels and emission allowances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy purchases, sells and transports natural gas to approximately 550,000 residential, commercial and industrial customers (as of December 31, 2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy serves 28 franchised counties covering approximately 12,000 square miles in North Carolina.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The predominant industries served by PSNC Energy include educational services, food products, health services, automotive, chemicals, non-woven textiles, electrical generation and construction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonregulated Businesses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA Energy markets natural gas in the southeast and provides energy-related services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A division of SCANA Energy sells natural gas to approximately 450,000 customers (as of December 31, 2016) in Georgias deregulated natural gas market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA Services, Inc. provides administrative and management services to SCANAs other subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MANAGEMENTS DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: OVERVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA, through its wholly-owned regulated subsidiaries, is primarily engaged in the generation, transmission, distribution and sale of electricity in South Carolina and in the purchase, transmission and sale of natural gas in North Carolina and South Carolina.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through a wholly-owned nonregulated subsidiary, SCANA markets natural gas to retail customers in Georgia and to wholesale customers in the southeast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A service company subsidiary of SCANA provides primarily administrative and management services to SCANA and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following map indicates areas where the Companys significant business segments conduct their activities, as further described in this overview section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following percentages reflect amounts attributable to the Companys regulated and nonregulated operations and other nonregulate (including the holding company and the services company).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016  2015  2014  Net Income               Regulated   98 %   72 %   98 % Nonregulated operations   5 %   4 %   7 % Other nonregulated   (3)%   24 %   (5)%              Assets               Regulated   97 %   97 %   95 % Nonregulated operations   1 %   1 %   2 % Other nonregulated   2 %   2 %   3 %
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the first quarter of 2015, SCANA closed on the sales of its interstate natural gas pipeline and telecommunications subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gains from these sales are included within Other.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Dispositions in Note 1 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Earnings Drivers and Outlook
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, companies announced plans to invest over $1.8 billion, with the expectation of creating approximately 7,000 jobs in the Companys South Carolina and North Carolina service territories.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At December 31, 2016, South Carolinas unemployment rate was 4.3%, which is approximately 1.2% lower than the prior year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each of the Companys regulated businesses experienced positive customer growth year over year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the next five years, key earnings drivers for the Company are expected to be additions to rate base at its regulated subsidiaries, consisting primarily of capital expenditures for new generating capacity, environmental facilities and system expansion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other factors that will impact future earnings growth include the regulatory environment, customer growth and usage in each of the regulated utility businesses, earnings in the natural gas marketing business and the level of growth of operation and maintenance, interest and other expenses and taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electric Operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs electric operations primarily generate electricity and provide for its transmission, distribution and sale to approximately 709,000 customers (as of December 31, 2016) in portions of South Carolina in an area covering nearly 17,000 square miles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENCO owns a coal-fired generating station and sells electricity solely to SCE&G.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fuel Company acquires, owns, provides financing for and sells at cost to SCE&G nuclear fuel, certain fossil fuels and emission and other environmental allowances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating results are primarily driven by customer demand for electricity, rates allowed to be charged to customers and the ability to control costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Demand for electricity is primarily affected by weather, customer growth and the economy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G is able to recover the cost of fuel used in electric generation through retail customers bills, but increases in fuel costs affect electricity prices and, therefore, the competitive position of electricity compared to other energy sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Embedded in the rates charged to customers is an allowed regulatory ROE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs allowed ROE in 2016 was 10.25% for non-BLRA rate base and 10.5% for BLRA-related rate base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For BLRA-related rate base existing prior to 2016, SCE&Gs allowed ROE was 11.0%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Nuclear Construction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G, on behalf of itself and as agent for Santee Cooper, has contracted with the Consortium for the design and construction of two 1,250 MW (1,117 MW, net) nuclear generation units, which SCE&G will jointly own with Santee Cooper.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs current ownership share in the New Units is 55%, and SCE&G has agreed to acquire an additional 5% ownership from Santee Cooper in increments beginning with the commercial operation date of Unit 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 27, 2015, SCE&G, Santee Cooper and the Consortium reached a settlement regarding certain disputes, and the EPC Contract was amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The October 2015 Amendment became effective on December 31, 2015, and among other things, it resolved by settlement and release substantially all then-outstanding disputes between SCE&G and the Consortium.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The October 2015 Amendment also provided SCE&G and Santee Cooper an option, subject to regulatory approvals, to fix the total amount to be paid to the Consortium for its entire scope of work on the project after June 30, 2015, subject to certain exceptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, SCE&G petitioned the SCPSC for approval of updated construction and capital cost schedules for the New Units developed as a result of the October 2015 Amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 9, 2016, the SCPSC approved a settlement agreement among SCE&G, ORS and certain other parties concerning this petition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC also approved SCE&Gs election of the fixed price option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approved construction schedule designates contractual guaranteed substantial completion dates of August 31, 2019 and August 31, 2020 for Units 2 and 3, respectively, although recent communications from WEC indicate substantial completion dates of April 2020 and December 2020 for Units 2 and 3, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These later dates remain within SCPSC-approved 18month contingency periods provided for under the BLRA, and achievement of such dates would also allow the output of both units to qualify, under current law, for federal production tax credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, there is substantial uncertainty as to WECs ability to meet these dates given its historical inability to meet forecasted productivity and work force efficiency levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approved capital cost schedule includes incremental capital costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs total project capital cost is now estimated at approximately $6.8 billion including owners costs and transmission, or $7.7 billion with escalation and AFC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the SCPSC approved revising SCE&Gs allowed ROE for new nuclear construction from 10.5% to 10.25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This revised ROE will be applied prospectively for the purpose of calculating revised rates sought by SCE&G under the BLRA on and after January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, SCE&G may not file future requests to amend capital cost schedules prior to January 28, 2019, unless its annual revised rate request is denied because SCE&G is out of compliance with its approved capital cost schedule or BLRA construction milestone schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In most circumstances, if the projected commercial operation date for Unit 2 is extended, the expiration of the January 28, 2019 moratorium will be extended by an equal amount of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and Santee Cooper, the co-owner of the New Units, continue to evaluate various actions which might be taken in the event that Toshiba and WEC are unable or unwilling to complete the project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include completing the work under any of several arrangements with other contractors or, were it determined to be prudent, halting the project, leaving SCE&G to pursue cost recovery under the abandonment provisions of the BLRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any significant delay in the timing of construction or any determination by the SCPSC to disallow the recovery of costs would adversely impact results of operations, cash flows and financial condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information summarized above, as well as additional information regarding uncertainties concerning WECs ability to continue to fulfill its performance and financial commitments and Toshibas ability to perform under its payment guaranty with respect to the project and other related matters, is further discussed in Note 2 and Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of recent elections may affect the pace at which federal environmental laws and regulations are enacted or how stringently their provisions are interpreted in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, public sentiment surrounding air quality and water quality remains strong and is expected to continue unabated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over several years, SCE&G has made significant investments in constructing non-emitting generation (the New Units previously mentioned) and retiring certain coal-fired plants or converting them to burn natural gas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, SCE&G expects to add the renewable energy from six new solar generating facilities at locations throughout its electric service territory over the next few years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The impact of these investments is expected to result in a significant shift toward non-emitting sources of fuel used to generate electricity in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generation Type      2016 Actual 2021 Projected Nuclear   24.7 %   56.7 % Hydro   3.3 %   3.4 % Solar    %   2.2 % Total Non-emitting   28.0 %   62.3 %           Biomass   1.7 %    % Natural Gas   33.5 %   17.9 % Coal   36.8 %   19.8 % Total Generation   100.0 %   100.0 %
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, SCE&G and GENCO have made significant investments to install pollution control equipment at their remaining coal-fired plants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These investments, together with investments in non-emitting generation, have reduced their air emissions and are expected to result in additional reductions in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: *    Projected
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The status of significant environmental laws and regulations and certain initiatives undertaken to ensure compliance with them are described in Environmental Matters herein and in Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, uncertainties with respect to the New Units are described in Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas Distribution
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The local distribution operations of SCE&G and PSNC Energy purchase, transport and sell natural gas to approximately 907,000 retail customers (as of December 31, 2016) in portions of South Carolina and North Carolina in areas covering approximately 35,000 square miles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating results for gas distribution are primarily influenced by customer demand for natural gas, rates allowed to be charged to customers and the ability to control costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Embedded in the rates charged to customers is an allowed regulatory ROE for SCE&G of 10.25% and for PSNC Energy of 10.60% through October 31, 2016 and 9.7% thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Demand for natural gas is primarily affected by weather, customer growth, the economy and the availability and price of alternate fuels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Natural gas competes with electricity, propane and heating oil to serve the heating and, to a lesser extent, other household energy needs of residential and small commercial customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This competition is generally based on price and convenience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Large commercial and industrial customers often have the ability to switch from natural gas to an alternate fuel, such as propane or fuel oil.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Natural gas competes with these alternate fuels based on price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, any significant disparity between supply and demand, either of natural gas or of alternate fuels, and due either to production or delivery disruptions or other factors, will affect price and will impact the Companys ability to retain large commercial and industrial customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The production of shale gas in the United States continues to keep prices for this commodity at historic lows, and such prices are expected to continue at generally low levels for several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The supply of natural gas from the Marcellus shale basin has prompted companies unaffiliated with SCANA to propose a 550mile pipeline that would bring natural gas from West Virginia to Virginia and North Carolina.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This pipeline is expected to be completed in late 2019 and, if successful, it may drive economic development along its path, including areas within PSNC Energys service territory, and may serve to assist in keeping natural gas competitively priced in the region.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas Marketing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA Energy markets natural gas in the southeast and provides energy-related services to customers, including, notably, retail customers in Georgia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating results for energy marketing are influenced by customer demand for natural gas and the ability to control costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The price of alternate fuels and customer growth significantly affect demand for natural gas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects to meet contractual cash obligations in 2017 through internally generated funds and additional short- and long-term borrowings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company may also meet such obligations through the sale of equity securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects that, barring a future impairment of the capital markets or its access to such markets, it has or can obtain adequate sources of financing to meet its projected cash requirements for the foreseeable future, including the cash requirements for nuclear construction and refinancing maturing long-term debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash requirements for SCANAs regulated subsidiaries arise primarily from their operational needs, funding their construction programs and payment of dividends to SCANA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ability of the regulated subsidiaries to replace existing plant investment, to expand to meet future demand for electricity and gas and to install equipment necessary to comply with environmental regulations, will depend on their ability to attract the necessary financial capital on reasonable terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulated subsidiaries recover the costs of providing services through rates charged to customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rates for regulated services are generally based on historical costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As customer growth and inflation occur and these subsidiaries continue their ongoing construction programs, rate increases will be sought.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The future financial position and results of operations of regulated subsidiaries will be affected by their ability to obtain adequate and timely rate and other regulatory relief.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due primarily to the availability of proceeds from the sale of two subsidiaries in the first quarter of 2015, the Company began using open market purchases for its stock plans at the end of January 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the use of open market purchases, SCANA common stock was acquired on behalf of participants in SCANAs Investor Plus Plan and Stock Purchase-Savings Plan through the original issuance of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This provided additional equity of approximately $14 million in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rating agencies consider qualitative and quantitative factors when assessing SCANA and its rated operating companies credit ratings, including regulatory environment, capital structure and the ability to meet liquidity requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in the regulatory environment or deterioration of the Companys or its rated operating companies commonly monitored financial credit metrics and adverse developments with respect to nuclear construction could negatively affect the Companys debt ratings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This could cause the Company to pay higher interest rates on its long- and short-term indebtedness, and could limit the Companys access to capital markets and liquidity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash provided from operating activities in 2015 reflects lower tax payments arising from Congress extension of bonus deprecation provisions in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash provided from operating activities in 2016 reflects significant tax benefits (reductions in income tax payments) arising from the deduction under Section 174 of the IRC of certain expenditures related to the design and construction of the New Units and the related claim of credits under Section 41 of the IRC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similar tax benefits are expected to be claimed in the next several years as design and construction continues, and these cash flows are expected to continue to supplant portions of financing which would otherwise be obtained in the capital markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is party to certain NYMEX natural gas futures contracts for which any unfavorable market movements are funded in cash.

sentences.text: These derivatives are accounted for as cash flow hedges and their effects are reflected within other comprehensive income until the anticipated sales transactions occur.

sentences.text: ENVIRONMENTAL MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The operations of the Company are subject to extensive regulation by various federal and state authorities in the areas of air quality, water quality, control of toxic substances and hazardous and solid wastes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applicable statutes and rules include the CAA, CWA, Nuclear Waste Act and CERCLA, among others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In many cases, regulations proposed by such authorities could have a significant impact on financial condition, results of operations and cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the conditions or requirements that will be imposed by regulatory or legislative proposals often cannot be predicted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that compliance with environmental regulations or legislation results in capital expenditures or operating costs, recovery of such expenditures and costs are expected through existing ratemaking provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the three years ended December 31, 2016, capital expenditures for environmental control equipment at fossil fuel generating stations totaled $39.5 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this same period, expenditures were made for the construction and retirement of landfills and ash ponds, net of disposal proceeds, of approximately $32.8 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, expenditures were made to operate and maintain environmental control equipment at fossil plants of $9.5 million in 2016, $8.7 million in 2015 and $9.1 million in 2014, which are included in other operation and maintenance expense, and expenditures were made to handle waste ash, net of disposal proceeds, of $2.4 million in 2016, $1.3 million in 2015 and $1.6 million in 2014, which are included in fuel used in electric generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, included within other operation and maintenance expense is an annual amortization of $1.4 million in each of 2016, 2015 and 2014 related to SCE&Gs recovery of MGP remediation costs as approved by the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is not possible to estimate all future costs related to environmental matters, but forecasts for capitalized environmental expenditures for the Company are $38.3 million for 2017 and $120 million for the four-year period 20182021.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These expenditures are included in the Estimated Capital Expenditures table, discussed in Liquidity and Capital Resources, and include known costs related to the matters discussed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EPA is conducting an enforcement initiative against the utilities industry related to the NSR provisions and the NSPS of the CAA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the initiative, many utilities have received requests for information under Section 114 of the CAA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the DOJ, on behalf of the EPA, has taken civil enforcement action against several utilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary basis for these actions is the assertion by the EPA that maintenance activities undertaken by the utilities at their coal-fired power plants constituted major modifications which required the installation of costly BACT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the utilities subject to the actions have reached settlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Though the Company cannot predict what action, if any, the EPA will initiate against it, any costs incurred are expected to be recoverable through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the pervasive emergence of concern over the issue of global climate change as a significant influence upon the economy, SCANA, SCE&G and GENCO are subject to climate-related financial risks, including those involving regulatory requirements responsive to GHG emissions, as well as those involving other potential physical impacts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other business and financial risks arising from such climate change could also materialize.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company cannot predict all of the climate-related regulatory and physical risks nor the related consequences which might impact the Company, and the following discussion should not be considered all-inclusive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Physical effects associated with climate changes could include changes in weather patterns, such as storm frequency and intensity, and any resultant damage to the Companys electric and gas systems, as well as impacts on employees and customers, the supply chain and many others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Much of the service territory of SCE&G is subject to the damaging effects of Atlantic and Gulf coast hurricanes and also to the damaging impact of winter ice storms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To help mitigate the financial risks arising from these potential occurrences, SCE&G maintains insurance on certain properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its ongoing operations, SCE&G maintains emergency response and storm preparation plans and teams who receive ongoing training and related simulations, all in order to allow for the protection of assets and the return of systems to normal reliable operation in a timely fashion following any such event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental commitments and contingencies are further described in Note 10 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REGULATORY MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA and its subsidiaries are subject to the regulatory jurisdiction of the following entities for the matters noted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Regulatory Jurisdiction/Matter
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA The SEC as to the issuance of certain securities and other matters and the FERC as to certain acquisitions and other matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA and all subsidiaries The CFTC, under Dodd-Frank, concerning recordkeeping, reporting, and other related regulations associated with swaps, options, forward contracts, and trade options, to the extent SCANA and any of its subsidiaries engage in any such activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G The SEC as to the issuance of certain securities and other matters; the SCPSC as to retail electric and gas rates, service, accounting, issuance of securities (other than short-term borrowings) and other matters; the FERC as to issuance of short-term borrowings, guarantees of short-term indebtedness, certain acquisitions, wholesale electric power and transmission rates and services, the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce, the wholesale sale of electric energy, the licensing of hydroelectric projects and other matters, including accounting; the DOE under the Federal Power Act as to use of emergency authority and coordination of all applicable federal authorizations and related environmental reviews to site an electric transmission facility; and the NRC with respect to the ownership, construction, operation and decommissioning of its currently operated and planned nuclear generating facilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NRC jurisdiction encompasses broad supervisory and regulatory powers over the construction and operation of nuclear reactors, including matters of health and safety and environmental impact.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Federal Emergency Management Agency reviews, in conjunction with the NRC, certain aspects of emergency planning relating to the operation of nuclear plants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and PSNC Energy The PHMSA and the DOT as to federal pipeline safety requirements for gas distribution pipeline systems and natural gas transmission systems, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ORS and the NCUC are responsible for enforcement of federal and state pipeline safety requirements in South Carolina (SCE&G) and North Carolina (PSNC Energy), respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA Energy The GPSC through its certification as a natural gas marketer in Georgia and specifically as to retail prices for customers served under its regulated provider contract.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material retail rate proceedings are described in Note 2 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the RSA allows natural gas distribution companies in South Carolina to request annual adjustments to rates to reflect changes in revenues and expenses and changes in investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such annual adjustments are subject to certain qualifying criteria and review by the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs electric transmission system and certain facilities related to generation and distribution are subject to NERC, which develops and enforces reliability standards for the bulk power systems throughout North America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NERC is subject to oversight by FERC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dodd-Frank provides for substantial additional regulation of over-the-counter and security-based derivative instruments, among other things, and requires numerous rule-makings by the CFTC and the SEC to implement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has determined that it meets the end-user exception in Dodd- Frank, with the lowest level of required regulatory reporting burden imposed by this law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is currently complying with these enacted regulations and intends to comply with regulations enacted in the future, but cannot predict when the final regulations will be issued or what requirements they will impose.

sentences.text: CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND ESTIMATES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following are descriptions of the accounting policies and estimates which are most critical in terms of reporting financial condition or results of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting for Rate Regulated Operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulated utilities record certain assets and liabilities that defer the recognition of expenses and revenues to future periods in accordance with accounting guidance for rate-regulated utilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, in the event of deregulation or other changes in the regulatory environment, the criteria of accounting for rate-regulated utilities may no longer be met, and the write off of regulatory assets and liabilities could be required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such an event could have a material effect on the results of operations, liquidity or financial position of the Electric Operations and Gas Distribution segments in the period the write-off would be recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Note 2 to the consolidated financial statements for a description of the regulatory assets and liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generation assets would be exposed to considerable financial risks in a deregulated electric market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If market prices for electric generation do not produce adequate revenue streams and the enabling legislation or regulatory actions do not provide for recovery of the resulting stranded costs, a write down in those assets could be required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is not possible to predict whether any write-downs would be necessary and, if they were, the extent to which they would affect results of operations in the period in which they would be recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, net investments in fossil/hydro and nuclear generation assets were approximately $2.2 billion and $5.0 billion, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue Recognition and Unbilled Revenues
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues related to the sale of energy are recorded when service is rendered or when energy is delivered to customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because customers of the utilities and retail gas operations are billed on cycles which vary based on the timing of the actual reading of their electric and gas meters, estimates are recorded for unbilled revenues at the end of each reporting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such unbilled revenue amounts reflect estimates of the amount of energy delivered to customers for which they have not yet been billed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such unbilled revenues reflect consideration of estimated usage by customer class, the effects of different rate schedules and, where applicable, the impact of weather normalization or other regulatory provisions of rate structures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accrual of unbilled revenues in this manner properly matches revenues and related costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys accounts receivable included unbilled revenues of $178.9 million at December 31, 2016 and $129.1 million at December 31, 2015, compared to total revenues of $4.2 billion in 2016 and $4.4 billion in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear Decommissioning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting for decommissioning costs for nuclear power plants involves significant estimates related to costs to be incurred many years into the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among the factors that could change SCE&Gs accounting estimates related to decommissioning costs are changes in technology, changes in regulatory and environmental remediation requirements, and changes in financial assumptions such as discount rates and the estimated timing of cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in any of these estimates could significantly impact financial position and cash flows (although changes in such estimates should be earnings-neutral, because these costs are expected to be collected from ratepayers).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on a decommissioning cost study, SCE&Gs two-thirds share of estimated site-specific nuclear decommissioning costs for Unit 1, including both the cost of decommissioning plant components that are and are not subject to radioactive contamination, totals $786.4 million, stated in 2016 dollars.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Santee Cooper is responsible for decommissioning costs related to its one-third ownership interest in Unit 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cost estimate assumes that upon closure the site would be maintained for 60 years in such a manner as to allow for subsequent decontamination that would permit release for unrestricted use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SCE&Gs method of funding decommissioning costs, SCE&G transfers to an external trust fund the amounts collected through rates, less expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trust invests the amounts transferred into insurance policies on the lives of certain company personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Insurance proceeds are reinvested in insurance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trusteed asset balance reflects the net cash surrender value of the insurance policies and cash held by the trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management intends for the fund, including earnings thereon, to provide for all eventual decommissioning expenditures for Unit 1 on an after-tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Asset Retirement Obligations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AROs are accrued for legal obligations associated with the retirement of long-lived tangible assets that result from acquisition, construction, development and normal operation in accordance with applicable accounting guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These obligations are recognized at present value in the period in which they are incurred, and associated asset retirement costs are capitalized as part of the carrying amount of the related long-lived assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because such obligations relate primarily to regulated utility operations, their recognition has no significant impact on results of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the Company has recorded AROs of $199 million for nuclear plant decommissioning (as discussed above) and AROs of $359 million for other conditional obligations primarily related to other generation, transmission and distribution properties, including gas pipelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the amounts are based upon estimates which are subject to varying degrees of precision, particularly since payments in settlement of such obligations may be made many years in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in these estimates will be recorded over time; however, these changes in estimates are not expected to materially impact results of operations so long as the regulatory framework for the utilities remains in place.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting for Pensions and Other Postretirement Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company recognizes the funded status of its defined benefit pension plan as an asset or liability and changes in funded status as a component of net periodic benefit cost or other comprehensive income, net of tax, or as a regulatory asset as required by accounting guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting guidance requires the use of several assumptions that impact pension cost, of which the discount rate and the expected return on assets are the most sensitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net pension cost of $22.9 million recorded in 2016 reflects the use of a 4.68% discount rate derived using a cash flow matching technique, and an assumed 7.50% long-term rate of return on plan assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that these assumptions and the resulting pension cost amount were reasonable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of comparison, a 25 basis point reduction in the discount rate in 2016 would have increased the Companys pension cost by $1.6 million and increased the pension obligation by $23.2 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, had the assumed long-term rate of return on assets been 7.25%, the Companys pension cost for 2016 would have increased by $1.9 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following information with respect to pension assets (and returns thereon) should also be noted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In developing the expected long-term rate of return assumptions, the Company evaluates historical performance, targeted allocation amounts and expected payment terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the beginning of 2016, the plans historical 10, 15, 20 and 25 year cumulative performance showed actual returns of 5.3%, 4.6%, 7.2% and 8.7%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 expected long-term rate of return of 7.50% was based on a target asset allocation of 58% with equity managers, 33% with fixed income managers and 9% with hedge fund managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management regularly reviews such allocations and periodically rebalances the portfolio when considered appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the beginning of 2017, the plans historical 10, 15, 20 and 25 year cumulative performance showed actual returns of 5.1%, 5.4%, 6.9% and 8.2%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, it is anticipated that the long-term expected rate of return will be 7.25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to regulatory orders, certain previously deferred pension costs are being amortized as described in Note 2 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current pension expense for electric operations is being recovered through a pension cost rider, and current pension expense related to SCE&Gs and PSNC Energys gas operations is being recovered through cost of service rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension benefits are not offered to employees hired or rehired after 2013, and pension benefits for existing participants will no longer accrue for services performed or compensation earned after 2023.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the significance of pension costs and the criticality of the related estimates will continue to diminish.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the pension trust is adequately funded under current regulations, and management does not anticipate the need to make significant pension contributions for the foreseeable future based on current market conditions and assumptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company accounts for the cost of its postretirement medical and life insurance benefit plan in a similar manner to that used for its defined benefit pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This plan is unfunded, so no assumptions related to rate of return on assets impact the net expense recorded; however, the selection of discount rates can significantly impact the actuarial
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: determination of net expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company used a discount rate of 4.78%, derived using a cash flow matching technique, and recorded a net cost for 2016 of $17.3 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Had the selected discount rate been 4.53% (25 basis points lower than the discount rate referenced above), the expense for 2016 would have been $0.7 million higher and increased the obligation by $8.3 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the plan provisions include caps on company per capita costs, and because employees hired after 2010 are responsible for the full cost of retiree medical benefits elected by them, health care cost inflation rate assumptions do not materially impact the net expense recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Uncertain Income Tax Positions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2013 and 2014, SCANA amended certain of its income tax returns to claim additional tax-defined research and experimentation deductions (under IRC Section 174) and credits (under IRC Section 41) and to reflect related impacts on other items such as domestic production activities deductions (under IRC Section 199).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA also made similar claims in filing its original 2013 and 2014 returns in 2014 and 2015, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2016, SCANA claimed significant research and experimentation deductions and credits (offset by reductions in its domestic production activities deductions), related to the ongoing design and construction activities of the New Units, in its 2015 income tax returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These claims followed the issuance of final IRS regulations in 2014 regarding such treatment with respect to expenditures related to the design and construction of pilot models.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Note 5 to the consolidated financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These income tax deductions and credits are considered to be uncertain tax positions, and under relevant accounting guidance, estimates of the amounts of related tax benefits which may not be sustained upon examination by the taxing authorities are required to be recorded as unrecognized tax benefits in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, such estimated unrecognized tax benefits totaled $350 million ($219 million net of the impact of state deductions on federal returns, and net of certain operating loss and tax credit carryforwards and receivables related to the uncertain tax positions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The estimates of unrecognized tax benefits were computed with consideration as to whether the claims are (or are not) more likely than not to be sustained and with consideration of analyses of cumulative probabilities regarding potential outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such estimates involve significant management judgment and varying levels of precision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in such estimates are required to be recorded as circumstances change and additional information regarding the claims and potential outcomes becomes available, and these changes could be significant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, as these uncertain tax positions primarily involve the timing of recognition of tax deductions rather than permanent tax attributes, the estimates regarding their recognition do not significantly impact the Companys effective tax rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the permanent attributes (net), as well as most of the interest accruals required to be recorded with respect to the unrecognized tax benefits, have been deferred within regulatory assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, the impacts of these significant accounting estimates, and changes therein, are primarily reflected on the balance sheet rather than in results of operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon resolution of the uncertainties, the Company will be required to re-pay any tax benefits claimed which are ultimately disallowed, along with interest on those amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In certain circumstances, which the Company considers to be remote, penalties for underpayment of income taxes could also be assessed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such amounts could be significant and adversely affect cash flow and financial condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Board of Directors and Stockholders of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of SCANA Corporation and subsidiaries (the "Company") as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of  income, comprehensive income, cash flows, and changes in common equity for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These financial statements and the financial statement schedule are the responsibility of the Companys management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the financial statements and financial statement schedule based on our audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our opinion, such consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company as of December 31, 2016 and 2015, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2016, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the Companys internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on the criteria established in Internal Control-Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission and our report dated February 24, 2017 expressed an unqualified opinion on the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA, a South Carolina corporation, is a holding company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company engages predominantly in the generation and sale of electricity to wholesale and retail customers in South Carolina, the purchase, sale and transportation of natural gas to wholesale and retail customers in South Carolina, North Carolina and Georgia and conducts other energy-related business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accompanying consolidated financial statements reflect the accounts of SCANA, the following wholly-owned subsidiaries, and subsidiaries that formerly were wholly-owned during the periods presented.

sentences.text: Intercompany balances and transactions hav been eliminated in consolidation, with the exception of profits on intercompany sales to regulated affiliates if the sales price is reasonable and the future recovery of the sales price through the rate-making process is probable, as permitted by accounting guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dispositions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the first quarter of 2015, SCANA sold CGT and SCI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CGT was an interstate natural gas pipeline regulated by FERC that transported natural gas in South Carolina and southeastern Georgia, and it was sold to Dominion Resources, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCI provided fiber optic communications and other services and built, managed and leased communications towers in several southeastern states, and it was sold to Spirit Communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sales resulted in recognition of pre-tax gains totaling approximately $342 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pre-tax gain from the sale of CGT is included within Operating Income and the pre-tax gain from the sale of SCI is included within Other Income (Expense) on the consolidated statement of income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CGT and SCI operated principally in wholesale markets, whereas the Companys primary focus is the delivery of energy-related products and services to retail markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, neither CGT nor SCI met accounting criteria for disclosure as a reportable segment and were included within All Other in Note 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The sales of CGT and SCI did not represent a strategic shift that had a major effect on operations; therefore, these sales did not meet the criteria for classification as discontinued operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Estimates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The preparation of financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amount of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual results could differ from those estimates.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The costs of additions, replacements and betterments to utility plant, including direct labor, material and indirect charges for engineering, supervision and AFC, are added to utility plant accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The original cost of utility property retired or otherwise disposed of is removed from utility plant accounts and generally charged to accumulated depreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The costs of repairs and replacements of items of property determined to be less than a unit of property or that do not increase the assets life or functionality are charged to expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AFC is a noncash item that reflects the period cost of capital devoted to plant under construction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This accounting practice results in the inclusion of, as a component of construction cost, the costs of debt and equity capital dedicated to construction investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AFC is included in rate base investment and depreciated as a component of plant cost in establishing rates for utility services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys regulated subsidiaries calculated AFC using average composite rates of 5.3% for 2016, 6.1% for 2015, and 7.2% for 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rates do not exceed the maximum rates allowed in the various regulatory jurisdictions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G capitalizes interest on nuclear fuel in process at the actual interest cost incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provisions for depreciation and amortization are recorded using the straight-line method based on the estimated service lives of the various classes of property.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, SCE&G adopted lower depreciation rates for electric and common plant, as approved by the SCPSC and further described in Note 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, CGT was sold in the first quarter of 2015 (see Dispositions herein) and excluded from the 2015 calculation of composite weighted average depreciation rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The composite weighted average depreciation rates for utility plant assets were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
