sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G records nuclear fuel amortization using the units-of-production method.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear fuel amortization is included in Fuel used in electric generation and recovered through the fuel cost component of retail electric rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provisions for amortization of nuclear fuel include amounts necessary to satisfy obligations to the DOE under a contract for disposal of spent nuclear fuel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jointly Owned Utility Plant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G jointly owns and is the operator of Unit 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, SCE&G will jointly own and will be the operator of the New Units being designed and constructed at the site of Summer Station.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each joint owner provides its own financing and shares the direct expenses and generation output in proportion to its ownership of a unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs share of the direct expenses is included in the corresponding operating expenses on its income statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31,   2016   2015       Unit 1   New Units   Unit 1   New Units   Percent owned       66.7%    55.0%    66.7%    55.0% Plant in service   $ 1.3  billion        $ 1.2  billion        Accumulated depreciation   $ 634.4 million        $ 620.4 million        Construction work in progress   $ 167.7 million   $ 4.2 billion  $ 214.6 million   $ 3.4 billion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of expected cash outlays and expected in-service dates for the New Units and a description of SCE&Gs agreement to acquire an additional 5% ownership in the New Units, see Note 10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Included within other receivables on the balance sheet were amounts due to SCE&G from Santee Cooper for its share of direct expenses and construction costs for Unit 1 and the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts totaled $76.2 million at December 31, 2016 and $178.8 million at December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Major Maintenance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Planned major maintenance costs related to certain fossil fuel turbine equipment and nuclear refueling outages are accrued in periods other than when incurred in accordance with approval by the SCPSC for such accounting treatment and rate recovery of expenses accrued thereunder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The difference between such cumulative major maintenance costs and cumulative collections is classified as a regulatory asset or regulatory liability on the consolidated balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other planned major maintenance is expensed when incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G is authorized to collect $18.4 million annually through electric rates to offset certain turbine maintenance expenditures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the years ended December 31, 2016, and 2015, SCE&G incurred $23.8 million and $16.5 million, respectively, for turbine maintenance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear refueling outages are scheduled 18 months apart.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As approved by the SCPSC, SCE&G accrues $17.2 million annually for its portion of the nuclear refueling outages scheduled from the spring of 2014 through the spring of 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Refueling outage costs incurred for which SCE&G was responsible totaled $26.8 million for the Fall 2015 outage and $1.8 million in 2016 in preparation for the Spring 2017 outage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Goodwill
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company considers certain amounts categorized by FERC as acquisition adjustments to be goodwill.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company tests goodwill for impairment annually as of January 1, unless indicators, events or circumstances require interim testing to be performed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accounting guidance adopted by the Company gives it the option to perform a qualitative assessment of impairment ("step zero").
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this qualitative assessment, if the Company determines that it is not more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount, the Company is not required to proceed with a two-step quantitative assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the quantitative assessment becomes necessary, step one requires estimation of the fair value of the reporting unit and the comparison of that amount to its carrying value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If this step indicates an impairment (a carrying value in excess of fair value), then step two, measurement of the amount of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: goodwill impairment (if any), is required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Should a write-down be required, such a charge would be treated as an operating expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each period presented, assets with a carrying value of $210 million for PSNC Energy (Gas Distribution segment), net of a writedown of $230 million taken in 2002, were classified as goodwill.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company utilized the step zero qualitative assessment in its evaluation as of January 1, 2017 and was not required to use the two-step quantitative assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluations for preceding periods, the Companys step one assessment utilized the assistance of an independent appraisal in determining its estimate of fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such evaluations, step one indicated no impairment, and no impairment charges were recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear Decommissioning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on a decommissioning cost study, SCE&Gs two-thirds share of estimated site-specific nuclear decommissioning costs for Unit 1, including the cost of decommissioning plant components both subject to and not subject to radioactive contamination, totals $786.4 million, stated in 2016 dollars.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Santee Cooper is responsible for decommissioning costs related to its one-third ownership interest in Unit 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cost estimate assumes that the site will be maintained over a period of approximately 60 years in such a manner as to allow for subsequent decontamination that would permit release for unrestricted use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under SCE&Gs method of funding decommissioning costs, SCE&G transfers to an external trust fund the amounts collected through rates ($3.2 million pre-tax in each period presented), less expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trust invests the amounts transferred into insurance policies on the lives of certain company personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Insurance proceeds are reinvested in insurance policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The trusteed asset balance reflects the net cash surrender value of the insurance policies and cash held by the trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management intends for the fund, including earnings thereon, to provide for all eventual decommissioning expenditures for Unit 1 on an after-tax basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash and Cash Equivalents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Temporary cash investments having original maturities of three months or less at time of purchase are considered to be cash equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These cash equivalents are generally in the form of commercial paper, certificates of deposit, repurchase agreements and treasury bills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receivables
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Customer receivables reflect amounts due from customers arising from the delivery of energy or related services and include both billed and unbilled amounts earned pursuant to revenue recognition practices described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Customer receivables are generally due within one month of receipt of invoices which are presented on a monthly cycle basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other receivables consist primarily of amounts due from Santee Cooper related to the construction and operation of jointly owned nuclear generating facilities at Summer Station.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Inventories
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Materials and supplies include the average cost of transmission, distribution, and generating plant materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Materials are charged to inventory when purchased and then expensed or capitalized to plant, as appropriate, at weighted average cost when used.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fuel inventory includes the average cost of coal, natural gas, fuel oil and emission allowances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fuel is charged to inventory when purchased and is expensed, at weighted average cost, as used and recovered through fuel cost recovery rates approved by the SCPSC or NCUC, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy utilizes an asset management and supply service agreement with a counterparty for certain natural gas storage facilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The counterparty held, through an agency relationship, 40% and 46% of PSNC Energys natural gas inventory at December 31, 2016 and December 31, 2015, respectively, with a carrying value of $9.8 million and $17.7 million, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of this agreement, PSNC Energy receives storage asset management fees of which 75% are credited to rate payers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy expects to replace this agreement when it expires on March 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Income Taxes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA files consolidated federal income tax returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under a joint consolidated income tax allocation agreement, each subsidiarys current and deferred tax expense is computed on a stand-alone basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recorded for the tax effects of all significant temporary differences between the book basis and tax basis of assets and liabilities at currently enacted tax rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred tax assets and liabilities are adjusted for changes in such tax rates through charges or credits to regulatory assets or liabilities if they are expected to be recovered from, or passed through to, customers of the Companys regulated subsidiaries; otherwise, they are charged or credited to income tax expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulatory Assets and Regulatory Liabilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys rate-regulated utilities record costs that have been or are expected to be allowed in the ratemaking process in periods different from the periods in which the costs would be charged to expense, or record revenues in periods different from the periods in which the revenues would be recorded, by a nonregulated enterprise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These expenses deferred for future recovery from customers or obligations for refunds to customers are primarily classified in the balance sheet as regulatory assets and regulatory liabilities (see Note 2) and are amortized consistent with the treatment of the related costs or revenues in the ratemaking process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred amounts expected to be recovered or repaid within 12 months are classified in the balance sheet as Receivables - Customer or Customer deposits and customer prepayments, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Debt Issuance Premiums, Discounts and Other Costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Premiums, discounts and debt issuance costs are presented within long-term debt and are amortized as components of interest charges over the terms of the respective debt issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For regulated subsidiaries, gains or losses on reacquired debt that is refinanced are recorded in other deferred debits or credits and are amortized over the term of the replacement debt, also as interest charges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An environmental assessment program is maintained to identify and evaluate current and former operations sites that could require environmental clean-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As site assessments are initiated, estimates are made of the amount of expenditures, if any, deemed necessary to investigate and remediate each site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental remediation liabilities are accrued when the criteria for loss contingencies are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These estimates are refined as additional information becomes available; therefore, actual expenditures could differ significantly from the original estimates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Probable and estimable costs are accrued related to environmental sites on an undiscounted basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts estimated and accrued to date for site assessments and clean-up relate solely to regulated operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts expected to be recovered through rates are recorded in regulatory assets and, if applicable, amortized over approved amortization periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other environmental costs are expensed as incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Income Statement Presentation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues and expenses arising from regulated businesses and retail natural gas marketing businesses (including those activities of segments described in Note 12) are presented within Operating Income, and all other activities are presented within Other Income (Expense).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with this presentation, the Company presents the 2015 gain on the sale of CGT within Operating Income and the 2015 gain on the sale of SCI within Other Income (Expense).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue Recognition
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues are recorded during the accounting period in which services are provided to customers and include estimated amounts for electricity and natural gas delivered but not billed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unbilled revenues totaled $178.9 million at December 31, 2016 and $129.1 million at December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fuel costs, emission allowances and certain environmental reagent costs for electric generation are collected through the fuel cost component in retail electric rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC establishes this component during fuel cost hearings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any difference between actual fuel costs and amounts contained in the fuel cost component is adjusted through revenue and is deferred and included when determining the fuel cost component during subsequent hearings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G customers subject to a PGA are billed based on a cost of gas factor calculated in accordance with a gas cost recovery procedure approved by the SCPSC and subject to adjustment monthly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any difference between actual gas costs and amounts contained in rates is adjusted through revenue and is deferred and included when making the next adjustment to the cost of gas factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energys PGA mechanism authorized by the NCUC allows the recovery of all prudently incurred gas costs, including the results of its hedging program, from customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any difference between actual gas costs and amounts contained in rates is deferred and included when establishing gas costs during subsequent PGA filings or in annual prudence reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs gas rate schedules for residential, small commercial and small industrial customers include a WNA which minimizes fluctuations in gas revenues due to abnormal weather conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy is authorized by the NCUC to utilize a CUT which allows it to adjust base rates semi-annually for residential and commercial customers based on average per customer consumption, whether impacted by weather or other factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taxes billed to and collected from customers are recorded as liabilities until they are remitted to the respective taxing authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such taxes are not included in revenues or expenses in the statements of income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earnings Per Share
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Basic earnings per share are computed by dividing net income by the weighted average number of common shares outstanding for the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When applicable, diluted earnings per share are computed using this same formula, after giving effect to securities considered to be dilutive potential common stock utilizing the treasury stock method.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Accounting Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance for revenue arising from contracts with customers that supersedes most earlier revenue recognition guidance, including industry-specific guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This new revenue recognition model provides a five-step analysis in determining when and how revenue is recognized, and will require revenue recognition to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration a company expects to receive in exchange for those goods or services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects to adopt this guidance when required in the first quarter of 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance permits adoption using a retrospective method, with options to elect certain practical expedients, or recognition of a cumulative effect in the year of initial adoption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not determined which method of adoption will be employed or what practical expedients may be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not determined the impact this guidance will have on its financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the identification of implementation project team members and the analysis of contracts with customers to which the guidance might be applicable, particularly large customer contracts, have begun.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, activities of the FASBs Transition Resource Group for Revenue Recognition are being monitored, particularly as they relate to the required treatment under the standard of contributions in aid of construction, alternative revenue programs and the collectibility of revenue of utilities subject to rate regulation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2015, the FASB issued accounting guidance removing the requirement to categorize within the fair value hierarchy investments for which fair values are estimated using the NAV practical expedient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Disclosures about investments in certain entities that calculate NAV per share are limited under this guidance to those investments for which the entity has elected to estimate the fair value using the NAV practical expedient.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company elected to adopt this guidance on a retrospective basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adoption resulted in the reclassification of fair value related to the pension plans investment in the common collective trust, joint venture interest, and limited partnership as of December 31, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Note 8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2015, the FASB issued accounting guidance intended to simplify the measurement of inventory cost by requiring most inventory to be measured at the lower of cost and net realizable value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects to adopt this guidance in the first quarter of 2017 and does not expect it to have a significant impact on the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance that will change how entities measure certain equity investments and financial liabilities, among other things.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects to adopt this guidance when required in the first quarter of 2018 and has determined adoption of this guidance will not have a significant impact on the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance related to the recognition, measurement and presentation of leases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance applies a right-of-use model and, for lessees, requires all leases with a duration over 12 months to be recorded on the balance sheet, with the rights of use treated as assets and the payment obligations treated as liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, and without consideration of any regulatory accounting requirements which may apply, depending primarily on the nature of the assets and the relative consumption of them, lease costs will be recognized either through the separate amortization of the right-of-use asset and the recognition of the interest cost related to the payment obligation, or through the recording of a combined straight-line rental expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For lessors, the guidance calls for the recognition of income either through the derecognition of assets and subsequent recording of interest income on lease amounts receivable, or through the recognition of rental income on a straight line basis, also depending on the nature of the assets and relative consumption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance will be effective for years beginning in 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not determined what impact this guidance will have on its financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the identification of implementation project team members and the initial identification and analysis of leasing and related contracts to which the guidance might be applicable have begun.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has begun evaluating certain third party software tools that may assist with this implementation and ongoing compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In March 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance changing how companies account for certain aspects of share-based payments to employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entities are required to recognize the income tax effects of awards in the income statement when the awards vest or are settled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company adopted this guidance in the fourth quarter of 2016 and, based on the nature of its share-based awards practices, the adoption had no impact on the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance requiring the use of a current expected credit loss impairment model for certain financial instruments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new model is applicable to trade receivables and most debt instruments, among other financial instruments, and is intended to result in certain impairment losses being recognized earlier than under current guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company must adopt this guidance beginning in 2020, including interim periods, though the guidance may be adopted in 2019.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not determined when this guidance will be adopted or what impact it will have on the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance to reduce diversity in cash flow classification related to certain transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects to adopt this guidance when required in the first quarter of 2018 and does not anticipate that its adoption will impact the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance related to the tax effects of intra-entity asset transfers of assets other than inventory.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An entity will be required to recognize the income tax consequences of an intra-entity transfer of an asset other than inventory when the transfer occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects to adopt this guidance in the first quarter 2017 and it is not expected to have a material impact on the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, the FASB issued accounting guidance related to the presentation of restricted cash on the statement of cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance is effective for years beginning in 2018 and the Company expects no impact on its financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, the FASB issued accounting guidance to simplify the accounting for goodwill impairment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance removes Step 2 of the goodwill impairment test.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The same one-step impairment test will be applied to goodwill at all reporting units, even those with zero or negative carrying amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidance is effective for years beginning in

sentences.text: RATE AND OTHER REGULATORY MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rate Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electric - Cost of Fuel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs retail electric rates include a cost of fuel component approved by the SCPSC which may be adjusted periodically to reflect changes in the price of fuel purchased by SCE&G.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to an April 2014 SCPSC order, SCE&G increased its base fuel cost component by approximately $10.3 million for the 12month period beginning with the first billing cycle of May 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base fuel cost increase was offset by a reduction in SCE&Gs rate rider related to pension costs approved by the SCPSC in March 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, pursuant to the April 2014 order, electric revenue for 2014 was reduced by approximately $46 million for adjustments to the fuel cost component and related under-collected fuel balance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such adjustments were fully offset by the recognition within other income of gains realized from the late 2013 settlement of certain interest rate derivatives which had been entered into in anticipation of the issuance of long-term debt, which gains had been deferred as a regulatory liability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The order also provided for the accrual of certain debt-related carrying costs on its under-collected balance of base fuel costs from May 1, 2014 through April 30, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cost of fuel includes amounts paid by SCE&G pursuant to the Nuclear Waste Act for the disposal of spent nuclear fuel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of a November 2013 decision by the Court of Appeals, the DOE set the Nuclear Waste Act fee to zero effective May 16, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The impact of changes to the Nuclear Waste Act fee is considered during annual fuel rate proceedings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order dated April 30, 2015, the SCPSC approved a settlement agreement among SCE&G and certain other parties in which SCE&G agreed to decrease the total fuel cost component of retail electric rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this order, SCE&G is to recover an amount equal to its under-collected balance of base fuel and variable environmental costs as of April 30, 2015, over the subsequent 12month period beginning with the first billing cycle of May 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order dated July 15, 2015, the SCPSC approved a settlement agreement among SCE&G, ORS, and certain other parties concerning SCE&Gs petition for approval to participate in a DER program and to recover DER program costs as a separate component of SCE&Gs overall fuel factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this order, SCE&G will, among other things, implement programs to encourage the development of renewable energy facilities with a total nameplate capacity of at least approximately 84.5 MW by the end of 2020, of which half is to be customer-scale solar capacity and half is to be utility- scale solar capacity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order dated September 16, 2015, the SCPSC approved SCE&Gs request to adopt lower depreciation rates for electric and common plant effective January 1, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rates were based on the results of a depreciation study conducted by SCE&G using utility plant balances as of December 31, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the adoption of the revised depreciation rates, SCE&G recorded lower depreciation expense of approximately $29 million ($.12 per share) in 2015, and pursuant to the SCPSC order, SCE&G reduced its electric operating revenues by approximately $14.5 million ($.06 per share) with an offset to under-collected fuel included within Receivables in the balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, SCE&Gs net income for 2015 increased approximately $9.8 million as a result of this change in estimate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order dated April 29, 2016, the SCPSC approved a settlement agreement among SCE&G, ORS and certain other parties to decrease the total fuel cost component of retail electric rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G reduced the total fuel cost component of retail electric rates to reflect lower projected fuel costs and to eliminate over-collected balances of approximately $61 million for base fuel and environmental costs over a 12month period beginning with the first billing cycle of May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G also began to recover projected DER program costs of approximately $6.9 million beginning with the first billing cycle of May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, the SCPSC initiated its 2017 annual review of base rates for fuel costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A public hearing for this annual review is scheduled for April 6, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electric - Base Rates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to an SCPSC order, SCE&G removes from rate base certain deferred income tax assets arising from capital expenditures related to the New Units and accrues carrying costs on those amounts during periods in which they are not included in rate base.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such carrying costs are determined at SCE&Gs weighted average long-term debt borrowing rate and are recorded as a regulatory asset and other income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carrying costs totaled $14.0 million and $9.5 million during 2016 and 2015, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G anticipates that when the New Units are placed in service and accelerated tax depreciation is recognized on them, these deferred income tax assets will decline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When these deferred income tax assets are fully offset by related deferred income tax liabilities, the carrying cost accruals will cease, and the regulatory asset will begin to be amortized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC has approved a suite of DSM Programs for development and implementation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G offers to its retail electric customers several distinct programs designed to assist customers in reducing their demand for electricity and improving their energy efficiency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G submits annual filings to the SCPSC related to these programs which include actual program costs, net lost revenues (both forecasted and actual), customer incentives, and net program benefits, among other things.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As actual DSM Program costs are incurred, they are deferred as regulatory assets and recovered through a rate rider approved by the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rate rider also provides for recovery of net lost revenues and for a shared savings incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC approved the following rate riders pursuant to the annual DSM Programs filings, which went into effect as indicated below:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Year      Effective      Amount 2016   First billing cycle of May   $ 37.6 million 2015   First billing cycle of May   $ 32.0 million 2014   First billing cycle of May   $ 15.4 million
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2014, the SCPSC issued an order approving, among other things, SCE&Gs request to utilize approximately $17.8 million of the gains from the late 2013 settlement of certain interest rate derivative instruments, previously deferred as regulatory liabilities, to offset a portion of SCE&Gs DSM Programs rate rider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This order also allowed SCE&G to apply $5.0 million of its storm damage reserve and $5.0 million of the gains from the settlement of certain interest rate derivative instruments to offset previously deferred amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order dated April 29, 2016, the SCPSC approved SCE&Gs request to increase its pension costs rider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increased pension rider is designed to allow SCE&G to recover projected pension costs, including under-collections, over a 12month period, beginning with the first billing cycle in May 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, SCE&G submitted its annual DSM Programs filing to the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If approved the filing would allow recovery of $37.0 million of costs and net lost revenues associated with the DSM Programs, along with an incentive to invest in such programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electric  BLRA
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the BLRA, SCE&G may file revised rates with the SCPSC each year to incorporate the financing cost of any incremental construction work in progress incurred for new nuclear generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rate adjustments are based on SCE&Gs updated cost of debt and capital structure and on an allowed ROE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC has approved recovery of the following amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: allowed ROE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC has approved recovery of the following amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, SCE&G petitioned the SCPSC for approval of updated construction and capital cost schedules for the New Units which were developed in connection with the October 2015 Amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 9, 2016, the SCPSC approved a settlement agreement among SCE&G, ORS and certain other parties concerning this petition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC also approved SCE&Gs election of the fixed price option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approved construction schedule designates contractual guaranteed substantial completion dates of August 31, 2019 and August 31, 2020 for Units 2 and 3, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approved capital cost schedule includes incremental capital costs that total $831 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs total project capital cost is now estimated at approximately $6.8 billion including owners costs and transmission, or $7.7 billion with escalation and AFC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the SCPSC approved revising SCE&Gs allowed ROE for new nuclear construction from 10.5% to 10.25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This revised ROE will be applied prospectively for the purpose of calculating revised rates sought by SCE&G under the BLRA on and after January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, SCE&G may not file future requests to amend capital cost schedules prior to January 28, 2019, unless its annual revised rate request is denied because SCE&G is out of compliance with its approved capital cost schedule or BLRA construction milestone schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In most circumstances, if the projected commercial operation date for Unit 2 is extended, the expiration of the January 28, 2019 moratorium will be extended by an equal amount of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also New Nuclear Construction in Note 10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 14, 2016, the SCPSC denied Petitions for Rehearing filed by certain parties that were not included in the settlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These parties may appeal this decision to the South Carolina Supreme Court once the SCPSCs order has been issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas - SCE&G
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The RSA is designed to reduce the volatility of costs charged to customers by allowing for more timely recovery of the costs that regulated utilities incur related to natural gas infrastructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC has approved the following rate changes pursuant to annual RSA filings effective with the first billing cycle of November in the following years:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Year      Action      Amount 2016   1.2% Increase  $ 4.1 million 2015   No change      2014   0.6% Decrease  $ 2.6 million
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs natural gas tariffs include a PGA that provides for the recovery of actual gas costs incurred, including transportation costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs gas rates are calculated using a methodology which may adjust the cost of gas monthly based on a 12month rolling average, and its gas purchasing policies and practices are reviewed annually by the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual reviews conducted for each of the 12month periods ended July 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 resulted in the SCPSC issuing an order finding that SCE&Gs gas purchasing policies and practices during each of the review periods were reasonable and prudent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas - PSNC Energy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energys Rider D rate mechanism allows it to recover from customers all prudently incurred gas costs and certain related uncollectible expenses as well as losses on negotiated gas and transportation sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy establishes rates using a benchmark cost of gas approved by the NCUC, which may be periodically adjusted to reflect changes in the market price of natural gas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy revises its tariffs as necessary to track these changes and accounts for any over- or under-collection of the delivered cost of gas in its deferred accounts for subsequent rate consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCUC reviews PSNC Energys gas purchasing practices annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, PSNC Energy utilizes a CUT which allows it to adjust its base rates semi-annually for residential and commercial customers based on average per customer consumption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 28, 2016, the NCUC granted PSNC Energy a net annual increase of approximately $19.1 million, or 4.39%, in rates and charges to customers, and set PSNC Energys authorized ROE at 9.7%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, PSNC Energy was authorized to implement a tracker that provides for biannual rate adjustments to recover the revenue requirement associated with integrity management plant investment and associated costs resulting from prevailing federal standards for pipeline integrity and safety that are not otherwise included in current base rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The new rates are effective for services rendered on or after November 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In November 2016, in connection with PSNC Energys 2016 Annual Prudence Review, the NCUC determined that PSNC Energys gas costs, including all hedging transactions, were reasonable and prudently incurred during the 12 months ended March 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulatory Assets and Regulatory Liabilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rate-regulated utilities recognize in their financial statements certain revenues and expenses in different periods than do other enterprises.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Company has recorded regulatory assets and regulatory liabilities which are summarized in the following tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than unrecovered plant, substantially all regulatory assets are either explicitly excluded from rate base or are effectively excluded from rate base due to their being offset by related liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: December 31, Millions of dollars      2016       2015  Regulatory Assets:         Accumulated deferred income taxes   $ 316   $ 298  AROs and related funding     425     405  Deferred employee benefit plan costs     342     325  Deferred losses on interest rate derivatives     620     535  Unrecovered plant     117     127  Environmental remediation costs     32     42  DSM Programs     59     61  Pipeline integrity management costs     33     19  Carrying costs on deferred tax assets related to nuclear construction     32     18  Deferred storm damage costs     20       Deferred costs related to uncertain tax position     15       Other     119     107  Total Regulatory Assets   $ 2,130   $ 1,937    Regulatory Liabilities:                Asset removal costs   $ 755   $ 732  Deferred gains on interest rate derivatives     151     96  Other     24     27  Total Regulatory Liabilities   $ 930   $ 855
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accumulated deferred income tax liabilities that arise from utility operations that have not been included in customer rates are recorded as a regulatory asset.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial portion of these regulatory assets relate to depreciation and are expected to be recovered over the remaining lives of the related property which may range up to approximately 85 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Similarly, accumulated deferred income tax assets arising from deferred investment tax credits are recorded as a regulatory liability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AROs and related funding represents the regulatory asset associated with the legal obligation to decommission and dismantle Summer Station and conditional AROs related to generation, transmission and distribution properties, including gas pipelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These regulatory assets are expected to be recovered over the related property lives and periods of decommissioning which may range up to approximately 110 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee benefit plan costs of the regulated utilities have historically been recovered as they have been recorded under GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred employee benefit plan costs represent amounts of pension and other postretirement benefit costs which were accrued as liabilities and treated as regulatory assets pursuant to FERC guidance, and costs deferred pursuant to specific SCPSC regulatory orders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2013 SCE&G began recovering through utility rates approximately $63 million of deferred pension costs for electric operations over approximately 30 years and approximately $14 million of deferred pension costs for gas operations over approximately 14 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The remainder of the deferred benefit costs are expected to be recovered through utility rates, primarily over average service periods of participating employees, or up to approximately 11 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred losses or gains on interest rate derivatives represent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the effective portions of changes in fair value and payments made or received upon settlement of certain interest rate derivatives designated as cash flow hedges and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the changes in fair value and payments made or received upon settlement of certain other interest rate derivatives not so designated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts recorded with respect to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) are expected to be amortized to interest expense over the lives of the underlying debt through 2043.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts recorded with respect to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) are expected to be similarly amortized to interest expense through 2065 except when, in the case of deferred gains, such amounts are applied otherwise at the direction of the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unrecovered plant represents the carrying value of coal-fired generating units, including related materials and supplies inventory, retired from service prior to being fully depreciated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to SCPSC approval, SCE&G is amortizing these amounts through cost of service rates over the units previous estimated remaining useful lives through approximately 2025.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unamortized amounts are included in rate base and are earning a current return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental remediation costs represent costs associated with the assessment and clean-up of sites currently or formerly owned by SCE&G or PSNC Energy, and are expected to be recovered over periods of up to approximately 18 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DSM Programs represent SCE&Gs deferred costs associated with such programs, and such deferred costs are currently being recovered over approximately five years through an approved rate rider.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pipeline integrity management costs represent costs incurred to comply with regulatory requirements related to natural gas pipelines located near moderate to high density populations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy will recover costs totaling $20.3 million over a five-year period beginning November 2016, and remaining costs of $7.0 million have been deferred pending future approval of rate recovery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G began amortizing $1.9 million of such costs annually in November 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carrying costs on deferred tax assets related to nuclear construction are calculated on accumulated deferred income tax assets associated with the New Units which are not part of electric rate base using the weighted average long-term debt cost of capital.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These carrying costs will be amortized over ten years beginning in approximately 2020.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred storm damage costs represent costs incurred in excess of amounts previously collected through SCE&Gs SCPSC-approved storm damage reserve, and for which SCE&G expects to receive future recovery through customer rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred costs related to uncertain tax position primarily represent the estimated amounts of domestic production activities deductions foregone as a result of the deduction of certain research and experimentation expenditures for income tax purposes, net of related tax credits, as well as accrued interest expense and other costs arising from this uncertain tax position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs current customer rates reflect the availability of domestic production activities deductions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These net deferred costs are expected to be recovered through utility rates following ultimate resolution of the claims.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Note 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Various other regulatory assets are expected to be recovered through rates over periods up to 2047.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Asset removal costs represent estimated net collections through depreciation rates of amounts to be incurred for the removal of assets in the uture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC, the NCUC or the FERC has reviewed and approved through specific orders most of the items shown as regulatory assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other regulatory assets include, but are not limited to, certain costs which have not been specifically approved for recovery by the SCPSC, the NCUC or by the FERC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recording such costs as regulatory assets, management believes the costs will be allowable under existing rate-making concepts that are embodied in rate orders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The costs are currently not being recovered, but are expected to be recovered through rates in future periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the future, as a result of deregulation or other changes in the regulatory environment or changes in accounting requirements, the Company could be required to write off its regulatory assets and liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such an event could have a material effect on the Companys financial statements in the period the write- off would be recorded.

sentences.text: During 2013 and 2014, SCANA amended certain of its income tax returns to claim additional tax-defined research and experimentation deductions (under IRC Section 174) and credits (under IRC Section 41) and to reflect related impacts on other items such as domestic production activities deductions (under IRC Section 199).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA also made similar claims in filing its original 2013 and 2014 returns in 2014 and 2015, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2016, SCANA claimed significant research and experimentation deductions and credits (offset by reductions in its domestic production activities deductions), related to the ongoing design and construction activities of the New Units, in its 2015 income tax returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These claims followed the issuance of final IRS regulations in 2014 regarding such treatment with respect to expenditures related to the design and construction of pilot models.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IRS examined the claims in the amended returns, and as the examination progressed without resolution, the Company evaluated and recorded adjustments to unrecognized tax benefits; however, none of these changes materially affected the Companys effective tax rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, the examination of the amended tax returns progressed to the IRS Office of Appeals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the IRS has begun an examination of SCANAs 2013 through 2015 income tax returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These income tax deductions and credits are considered to be uncertain tax positions, and under relevant accounting guidance, estimates of the amounts of related tax benefits which may not be sustained upon examination by the taxing authorities are required to be recorded as unrecognized tax benefits in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the Company has recorded an unrecognized tax benefit of $350 million ($219 million, net of the impact of state deductions on federal returns, and net of certain operating loss and tax credit carryforwards and receivables related to the uncertain tax positions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If recognized, $17 million of the tax benefit would affect the Companys effective tax rate (see discussion below regarding deferral of benefits related to 2015 forward).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is reasonably possible that these unrecognized tax benefits may increase by an additional $292 million within the next 12 months as additional expenditures giving rise to pilot model tax benefits are incurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is also reasonably possible that these unrecognized tax benefits may decrease by $49 million within the next 12 months if the claims on the amended returns which are currently in appeals are resolved and that resolution were also applied to the 2013 and 2014 returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No other material changes in the status of the Companys tax positions have occurred through December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the research and experimentation deduction and credit claims reflected on the 2015 income tax returns and the expectation of similar claims to be made in determining 2016s taxable income, the Company has recorded regulatory assets for estimated foregone domestic production activities deductions, offset by estimated tax credits, and expects that such (net) deferred costs, along with any interest (see below) and other related deferred costs, will be recoverable through customer rates in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs current customer rates reflect the availability of domestic production activities deductions (see Note 2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Estimated interest expense accrued with respect to the unrecognized tax benefits related to the research and experimentation deductions in the 2015 income tax returns has been deferred as a regulatory asset and is expected to be recoverable through customer rates in future years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Note 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DERIVATIVE FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Derivative instruments are recognized either as assets or liabilities in the statement of financial position and are measured at fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes in the fair value of derivative instruments are recognized either in earnings, as a component of other comprehensive income (loss) or, for regulated operations, within regulatory assets or regulatory liabilities, depending upon the intended use of the derivative and the resulting designation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policies and procedures, and in some cases risk limits, are established to control the level of market, credit, liquidity and operational and administrative risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANAs Board of Directors has delegated to a Risk Management Committee the authority to set risk limits, establish policies and procedures for risk management and measurement, and oversee and review the risk management process and infrastructure for SCANA and each of its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Management Committee, which is comprised of certain officers, including the Risk Management Officer and other senior officers, apprises the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors with regard to the management of risk and brings to their attention significant areas of concern.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Written policies define the physical and financial transactions that are approved, as well as the authorization requirements and limits for transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Commodity Derivatives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company uses derivative instruments to hedge forward purchases and sales of natural gas, which create market risks of different types.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instruments designated as cash flow hedges are used to hedge risks associated with fixed price obligations in a volatile market and risks associated with price differentials at different delivery locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instruments designated as fair value hedges are used to mitigate exposure to fluctuating market prices created by fixed prices of stored natural gas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The basic types of financial instruments utilized are exchange-traded instruments, such as NYMEX futures contracts or options, and over-the-counter instruments such as options and swaps, which are typically offered by energy companies and financial institutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash settlements of commodity derivatives are classified as operating activities in the consolidated statements of cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy hedges natural gas purchasing activities using over-the-counter options and NYMEX futures and options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energys tariffs include a provision for the recovery of actual gas costs incurred, including any costs of hedging.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSNC Energy records premiums, transaction fees, margin requirements and any realized gains or losses from its hedging program in deferred accounts as a regulatory asset or liability for the under- or over-recovery of gas costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These derivative financial instruments are not designated as hedges for accounting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unrealized gains and losses on qualifying cash flow hedges of nonregulated operations are deferred in AOCI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the hedged transactions affect earnings, previously recorded gains and losses are reclassified from AOCI to cost of gas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The effects of gains or losses resulting from these hedging activities are either offset by the recording of the related hedged transactions or are included in gas sales pricing decisions made by the business unit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an accommodation to certain customers, SCANA Energy, as part of its energy management services, offers fixed price supply contracts which are accounted for as derivatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sales contracts are offset by the purchase of supply futures and swaps which are also accounted for as derivatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the sales contracts nor the related supply futures and swaps are designated as hedges for accounting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest Rate Swaps
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest rate swaps may be used to manage interest rate risk and exposure to changes in fair value attributable to changes in interest rates on certain debt issuances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In cases in which swaps designated as cash flow hedges are used to synthetically convert variable rate debt to fixed rate debt, periodic payments to or receipts from swap counterparties related to these derivatives are recorded within interest expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Forward starting swap agreements that are designated as cash flow hedges may be used in anticipation of the issuance of debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as described in the following paragraph, the effective portions of changes in fair value and payments made or received upon termination of such agreements for regulated subsidiaries are recorded in regulatory assets or regulatory liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For SCANA and its nonregulated subsidiaries, such amounts are recorded in AOCI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to regulatory orders, interest rate derivatives entered into by SCE&G after October 2013 are not designated as cash flow hedges and fair value changes and settlement amounts related to them are recorded as regulatory assets and liabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Settlement losses on swaps will be amortized over the lives of subsequent debt issuances and gains may be amortized to interest expense or may be applied as otherwise directed by the SCPSC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash payments made or received upon termination of these financial instruments are classified as investing activities for cash flow statement purposes.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANAs policy has been to fund the plan as permitted by applicable federal income tax regulations, as determined by an independent actuary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension plan provides benefits under a cash balance formula for employees hired before January 1, 2000 who elected that option and all eligible employees hired subsequently.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the cash balance formula, benefits accumulate as a result of compensation credits and interest credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired before January 1, 2000 who elected to remain under the final average pay formula earn benefits based on years of credited service and the employees average annual base earnings received during the last three years of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the cash balance formula and the final average pay formula will continue to accrue through December 31, 2023, after which date no benefits will be accrued except that participants under the cash balance formula will continue to earn interest credits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to pension benefits, SCANA provides certain unfunded postretirement health care and life insurance benefits to certain active and retired employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirees hired before January 1, 2011 share in a portion of their medical care cost, while employees hired subsequently are responsible for the full cost of retiree medical benefits elected by them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investment Policies and Strategies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assets of the pension plan are invested in accordance with the objectives of (1) fully funding the obligations of the pension plan, (2) overseeing the plans investments in an asset-liability framework that considers the funding surplus (or deficit) between assets and liabilities, and overall risk associated with assets as compared to liabilities, and (3) maintaining sufficient liquidity to meet benefit payment obligations on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA uses a dynamic investment strategy for the management of the pension plan assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This strategy will lead to a reduction in equities and an increase in long duration fixed income allocations over time with the intention of reducing volatility of funded status and pension costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension plan operates with several risk and control procedures, including ongoing reviews of liabilities, investment objectives, levels of diversification, investment managers and performance expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The total portfolio is constructed and maintained to provide prudent diversification with regard to the concentration of holdings in individual issues, corporations, or industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions involving certain types of investments are prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include, except where utilized by a hedge fund manager, any form of private equity; commodities or commodity contracts (except for unleveraged stock or bond index futures and currency futures and options); ownership of real estate in any form other than publicly traded securities; short sales, warrants or margin transactions, or any leveraged investments; and natural resource properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investments made for the purpose of engaging in speculative trading are also prohibited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pension plan asset allocation at December 31, 2016 and 2015 and the target allocation for 2017 are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Percentage of Plan Assets       Target Allocation   December 31,   Asset Category      2017      2016     2015   Equity Securities   58%   57%   57%   Fixed Income   33%   32%   32%   Hedge Funds      9%   11%   11%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, the expected long-term rate of return on assets will be 7.25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In developing the expected long-term rate of return assumptions, management evaluates the pension plans historical cumulative actual returns over several periods, considers the expected active and passive returns across various asset classes and assumes the target allocation is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management regularly reviews such allocations and periodically rebalances the portfolio when considered appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional rebalancing may occur subject to funded status improvements as part of the dynamic investment strategy described previously.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair Value Measurements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assets held by the pension plan are measured at fair value and are classified in their entirety based on the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At December 31, 2016 and 2015, fair value measurements, and the level within the fair value hierarchy in which the measurements fall, were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Millions of dollars      2016      2015 Investments with fair value measure at Level 2:            Mutual funds  $ 125   $ 125 Short-term investment vehicles     16     14 US Treasury securities     18     22 Corporate debt securities     82     78 Municipals     14     14 Total assets in the fair value hierarchy    255     253             Investments at net asset value:           Common collective trust    453     413 Joint venture interests    86     83 Limited partnership         33 Total investments at fair value  $ 794   $ 782
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all periods presented, assets with fair value measurements classified as Level 1 were insignificant, and there were no assets with fair value measurements classified as Level 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no transfers of fair value amounts into or out of Levels 1, 2 or 3 during 2016 or 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2015 the fair value of pension plan assets totaling $413 million were previously depicted as mutual funds but have been reclassified as Common collective trust for the current presentation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mutual funds held by the plan are open-ended mutual funds registered with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The price of the mutual funds shares is based on its NAV, which is determined by dividing the total value of portfolio investments, less any liabilities, by the total number of shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For purposes of calculating NAV, portfolio securities and other assets for which market quotes are readily available are valued at market value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Short-term investment vehicles are funds that invest in short-term fixed income instruments and are valued using observable prices of the underlying fund assets based on trade data for identical or similar securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: US Treasury securities are valued using quoted market prices or based on models using observable inputs from market sources such as external prices or spreads or benchmarked thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate debt securities and municipals are valued based on recently executed transactions, using quoted market prices, or based on models using observable inputs from market sources such as external prices or spreads or benchmarked thereto.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Common collective trust assets and limited partnerships are valued at NAV, which has been determined based on the unit values of the trust funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unit values are determined by the organization sponsoring such trust funds by dividing the trust funds net assets at fair value by the units outstanding at each valuation date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joint venture interests assets are invested in a hedge fund of funds partnership that invests directly in multiple hedge fund strategies that are not traded on exchanges and not traded on a daily basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The valuation of such multi-strategy hedge fund of funds is estimated based on the NAV of the underlying hedge fund strategies using consistent valuation guidelines that account for variations that may influence their fair value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA sponsors a defined contribution plan in which eligible employees may defer up to 75% of eligible earnings subject to certain limits and may diversify their investments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions are matched 100% up to 6% of an employees eligible earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such matching contributions totaled $27.5 million in 2016, $26.2 million in 2015 and $25.8 million in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee deferrals, matching contributions, and earnings on all contributions are fully vested and non-forfeitable at all times.
