sentences.text: SHARE-BASED COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTECP provides for grants of nonqualified and incentive stock options, stock appreciation rights, restricted stock, performance shares, performance units and restricted stock units to certain key employees and non-employee directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The LTECP currently authorizes the issuance of up to five million shares of SCANAs common stock, no more than one million of which may be granted in the form of restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation cost is measured based on the grant-date fair value of the instruments issued and is recognized over the period that an employee provides service in exchange for the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share-based payment awards do not have non-forfeitable rights to dividends or dividend equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that the awards themselves do not vest, dividends or dividend equivalents which would have been paid on those awards do not vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 20142016 performance cycle provides for performance measurement and award determination on an annual basis, with payment of awards being deferred until after the end of the three-year performance cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 20152017 and 20162018 awards are based on performance over a single three-year cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the performance cycle for the 20142016 awards, 20% of the performance awards were granted in the form of restricted share units, which are liability awards payable in cash, and 80% of the awards were granted in performance shares, each of which has a value that is equal to, and changes with, the value of a share of SCANA common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each of the 20152017 and 20162018 awards, 30% are in the form of restricted share units and 70% are in the form of performance shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents are accrued on the performance shares and the restricted share units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance awards and related dividend equivalents are subject to forfeiture in the event of termination of employment prior to the end of the cycle, subject to certain exceptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts of performance share awards are determined by SCANAs performance against pre-determined measures of TSR as compared to a peer group of utilities (weighted 50%) and growth in GAAP-adjusted net earnings per share (weighted 50%).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation cost of liability awards is recognized over their respective three-year performance periods based on the estimated fair value of the award, which is periodically updated based on expected ultimate cash payout, and is reduced by estimated forfeitures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Companys discretion, awards under the 20142016 performance cycle were paid in cash in February 2017 totaling $28.0 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash-settled liabilities related to earlier performance cycles totaled approximately $18.4 million in 2016, $20.8 million in 2015 and $11.8 million in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fair value adjustments for all performance cycles resulted in compensation expense recognized in the statements of income totaling approximately $25.6 million in 2016, $18.0 million in 2015 and $20.3 million in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such fair value adjustments also resulted in capitalized compensation costs of $3.3 million in 2016, $2.3 million in 2015 and $3.1 million in 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At December 31, 2016, unrecognized compensation cost, which is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of 18 months, was $23.4 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear Insurance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Price-Anderson, SCE&G (for itself and on behalf of Santee-Cooper, a one-third owner of Unit 1) maintains agreements of indemnity with the NRC that, together with private insurance, cover third-party liability arising from any nuclear incident occurring at SCE&Gs nuclear power plant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Price-Anderson provides funds up to $13.4 billion for public liability claims that could arise from a single nuclear incident.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nuclear plant is insured against this liability to a maximum of $375 million by ANI with the remaining coverage provided by a mandatory program of deferred premiums that could be assessed, after a nuclear incident, against all owners of commercial nuclear reactors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each reactor licensee is currently liable for up to $127.3 million per reactor owned for each nuclear incident occurring at any reactor in the United States, provided that not more than $18.9 million of the liability per reactor would be assessed per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs maximum assessment, based on its two-thirds ownership of Unit 1, would be $84.8 million per incident, but not more than $12.6 million per year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both the maximum assessment per reactor and the maximum yearly assessment are adjusted for inflation at least every five years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G currently maintains insurance policies (for itself and on behalf of Santee Cooper) with NEIL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policies provide coverage to Unit 1 for property damage and outage costs up to $2.75 billion resulting from an event of nuclear origin and up to $2.33 billion resulting from an event of a non- nuclear origin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, a builders risk insurance policy has been purchased from NEIL for the construction of the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy provides the owners of the New Units up to $500 million of total coverage for accidental property damage occurring during construction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEIL policies, in the aggregate, are subject to a maximum loss of $2.75 billion for any single loss occurrence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEIL policies permit retrospective assessments under certain conditions to cover insurers losses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the current annual premium, SCE&Gs portion of the retrospective premium assessment would not exceed $45.8 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G currently maintains an excess property insurance policy (for itself and on behalf of Santee Cooper) with EMANI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides coverage to Unit 1 for property damage and outage costs up to $415 million resulting from an event of a non-nuclear origin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EMANI policy permits retrospective assessments under certain conditions to cover insurers losses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the current annual premium, SCE&Gs portion of the retrospective premium assessment would not exceed $1.8 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that insurable claims for property damage, decontamination, repair and replacement and other costs and expenses arising from an incident at Unit 1 exceed the policy limits of insurance, or to the extent such insurance becomes unavailable in the future, and to the extent that SCE&Gs rates would not recover the cost of any purchased replacement power, SCE&G will retain the risk of loss as a self-insurer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G has no reason to anticipate a serious nuclear or other incident.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if such an incident were to occur, it likely would have a material impact on the Companys results of operations, cash flows and financial position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Nuclear Construction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G, on behalf of itself and as agent for Santee Cooper, contracted with the Consortium in 2008 for the design and construction of the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs current ownership share in the New Units is 55%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed below, SCE&G has agreed to acquire an additional 5% ownership in the New Units from Santee Cooper.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EPC Contract and BLRA Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The construction of the New Units and SCE&Gs related recovery of financing costs through rates is subject to review and approval by the SCPSC as provided for in the BLRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the BLRA, the SCPSC has approved, among other things, a milestone schedule and a capital costs estimates schedule for the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approval constitutes a final and binding determination that the New Units are used and useful for utility purposes, and that the capital costs associated with the New Units are prudent utility costs and expenses and are properly included in rates, so long as the New Units are constructed or are being constructed within the parameters of the approved milestone schedule, including specified contingencies, and the approved capital costs estimates schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subject to the same conditions, the BLRA provides that SCE&G may apply to the SCPSC annually for an order to recover through revised rates SCE&Gs weighted average cost of capital applied to all or part of the outstanding balance of construction work in progress concerning the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Estimated operating costs, including the depreciation of the utility plant costs, are then to be recovered through rates beginning when the construction of each New Unit is completed and placed into service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The BLRA also provides that, in the event of abandonment prior to plant completion, construction work in progress costs incurred, including AFC, and a return on those costs may be recoverable through rates, so long as SCE&G demonstrates by a preponderance of the evidence that its decision to abandon the New Unit(s) was prudent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, SCE&Gs investment in the New Units, including related transmission, totaled $4.5 billion, for which the financing costs on $3.8 billion have been reflected in rates under the BLRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See Note 2 for a description of rate changes which have occurred under the BLRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC granted initial approval of the construction schedule and related forecasted capital costs in 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NRC issued COLs in March 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Consortium has experienced delays throughout much of the project to date, and forecasted work crew efficiency and productivity metrics have not been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response, in November 2012, and again in September 2015 and November 2016 (see discussion below), the SCPSC approved SCE&Gs requested updates to the milestone schedule, revised contractual substantial completion dates, and increases in capital and other costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of these increased costs were the result of the schedule delays and were the subject of dispute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: October 2015 Amendment and WECs Engagement of Fluor
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On October 27, 2015, SCE&G, Santee Cooper and the Consortium amended the EPC Contract.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The October 2015 Amendment became effective in December 2015, upon the consummation of the acquisition by WEC of the stock of Stone & Webster from CB&I.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following that acquisition, Stone & Webster continues to be a member of the Consortium as a subsidiary of WEC rather than CB&I, and WEC has engaged Fluor as a subcontracted construction manager.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things, the October 2015 Amendment provided SCE&G and Santee Cooper an irrevocable option to fix the total amount to be paid o the Consortium for its entire scope of work on the project (excluding a limited amount of work within the time and materials component of the contract price) after June 30, 2015 at $6.082 billion (SCE&Gs 55% portion being approximately $3.345 billion).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This total amount to be paid would be educed by amounts paid since June 30, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G, on behalf of itself and as agent for Santee Cooper, executed the fixed price option, subject to SCPSC approval, on July 1, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The October 2015 Amendment:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i)  resolved by settlement and release most outstanding disputes between SCE&G and the Consortium,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii)  revised the contractual guaranteed substantial completion dates of Units 2 and 3 to August 31, 2019 and 2020, respectively,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii)  revised the delay-related liquidated damages computation requirements, including those related to the eligibility of the New Units to earn Internal Revenue Code Section 45J production tax credits (see also below), resulting in escalating liquidated damages that are capped at an aggregate of $338 million per New Unit (SCE&Gs 55% portion being approximately $186 million per New Unit),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv)  provided for payment to the Consortium of a completion bonus of $150 million per New Unit (SCE&Gs 55% portion being approximately $83 million per New Unit) for each New Unit placed in service by the deadline to qualify for production tax credits,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v)  provided for development of a revised construction milestone payment schedule,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi)  provided that SCE&G and Santee Cooper waive and cancel the CB&I parent company guaranty with respect to the project,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii)  provided for an explicit definition of Change in Law designed to reduce the likelihood of certain future commercial disputes, with the Consortium also acknowledging and agreeing that the project scope includes providing New Units that meet the standards of the NRC approved Design Control Document Revision 19, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii)   eliminated the requirement or ability of any party to bring suit regarding disputes before substantial completion of the project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its responsibility as a subcontracted construction manager, Fluor has reviewed and assisted in the development of an updated ntegrated project schedule which reflects WECs revised estimated completion dates of April 2020 and December 2020 for Units 2 and 3, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These later dates remain within the SCPSC-approved 18month contingency periods provided for under the BLRA, and achievement of such dates would also allow the output of both units to qualify, under current law, for federal production tax credits (see below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, there is substantial uncertainty as to WECs ability to meet these dates given its historical inability to achieve forecasted productivity and work force efficiency levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: November 2016 SCPSC Order
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2016, SCE&G petitioned the SCPSC for approval of updated construction and capital cost schedules for the New Units which were developed in connection with the October 2015 Amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On November 9, 2016, the SCPSC
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approved a settlement agreement among SCE&G, ORS and certain other parties concerning this petition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SCPSC also approved SCE&Gs election of the fixed price option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also Note 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approved construction schedule designates contractual guaranteed substantial completion dates of August 31, 2019 and August 31, 2020 for Units 2 and 3, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approved capital cost schedule includes incremental capital costs that total $831 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs total project capital cost is now estimated at approximately $6.8 billion including owners costs and transmission, or $7.7 billion with escalation and AFC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the SCPSC approved revising SCE&Gs allowed ROE for new nuclear construction from 10.5% to 10.25%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This revised ROE will be applied prospectively for the purpose of calculating revised rates sought by SCE&G under the BLRA on and after January 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, SCE&G may not file future requests to amend capital cost schedules prior to January 28, 2019, unless its annual revised rate request is denied because SCE&G is out of compliance with its approved capital cost schedule or BLRA construction milestone schedule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In most circumstances, if the projected commercial operation date for Unit 2 is extended, the expiration of the January 28, 2019 moratorium will be extended by an equal amount of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 14, 2016, the SCPSC denied Petitions for Rehearing filed by certain parties that were not included in the settlement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These parties may appeal this decision to the South Carolina Supreme Court once the SCPSCs order has been issued.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Construction Milestone Payment Schedule and Related DRB Activity
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The October 2015 Amendment established a DRB process for resolving certain commercial claims and disputes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DRB is comprised of three members chosen by the parties, and amounts in dispute of less than $5 million will be resolved by the DRB without recourse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts in dispute greater than $5 million will be resolved by the DRB for the remainder of the construction of the New Units, with a reserved right to further arbitrate or to litigate such issues at the conclusion of construction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On December 2, 2016 the DRB issued an order establishing a construction milestone payment schedule (see (v) in October 2015 Amendment above) on which SCE&G and WEC had been unable to agree subsequent to the October 2015 Amendment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The dispute related only to the timing of payments; the total amount to be paid was not in dispute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The DRB order provides that certain subcontractor and other supplier-related costs incurred by the Consortium will be reimbursed by the owners regardless of payment-milestone completion, but that other payments will be made only upon documented achievement of the agreed-upon payment-milestones.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such subcontractor and other supplier-related costs comprised approximately $873 million of the $3.345 billion of fixed option payments that were the subject of the DRB order.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment and Performance Obligations and Certain Related Uncertainties
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment and performance obligations under the EPC Contract are joint and several obligations of WEC and Stone & Webster, and in connection with the October 2015 Amendment, Toshiba, WECs parent company, reaffirmed its guaranty of WECs payment obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the EPC Contract provides the owners the right, exercisable upon certain conditions, to obtain payment and performance bonds from WEC equal to 15% of the highest projected three months billings during the applicable year, and their aggregate nominal coverage will not exceed $100 million (or $55 million for SCE&Gs 55% share).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and Santee Cooper are responsible for the cost of the bonds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In late 2015, Toshibas credit ratings declined to below investment grade following disclosures regarding its operating and financial performance and near-term liquidity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, pursuant to the above-described terms of the EPC Contract, SCE&G has obtained standby letters of credit in lieu of payment and performance bonds from WEC totaling $45 million (or approximately $25 million for SCE&Gs 55% share).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These standby letters of credit expire annually in February, and they automatically renew for successive one-year periods until their final expiration date of August 31, 2020, unless the issuer provides a minimum 60day notice that it will not renew.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the issuer provides notice that it will not renew, SCE&G may draw upon the standby letter of credit prior to its expiration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that WEC would be unable to meet its payment and performance obligations under the EPC Contract, it is anticipated this funding would provide a source of liquidity to assist in an orderly transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the EPC Contract provides that upon the request of SCE&G, and at owners cost, the Consortium must escrow certain intellectual property and software for the owners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: benefit to assist in completion of the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An escrow arrangement has been established, and certain intellectual property and software have been deposited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional deposits are anticipated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016 through February 2017, Toshiba and WEC announced further deterioration in their financial position and liquidity related to write-downs arising from WECs acquisition of Stone and Webster from CB&I (discussed above).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The announcements noted that WEC and Toshiba have determined that significant losses will be incurred under the EPC Contract for the New Units and under a similar engineering, procurement and construction agreement for other units currently being constructed in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This determination has impacted their allocation of the CB&I purchase price, resulting in recognition of a large amount of goodwill which has in turn been determined to be impaired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Preliminary recognition of this impairment loss (in excess of $6 billion) has left Toshiba with negative shareholders equity and threatened its liquidity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, Toshibas credit ratings were further reduced.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In response, Toshiba has indicated its interest in monetizing portions of its business as it attempts to restructure and restore its financial position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Toshiba has also indicated that it will withdraw from the nuclear construction business prospectively and that it will significantly alter its risk management oversight of its nuclear power business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WEC has told the Company that it and Toshiba are committed to completing the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Toshiba has acknowledged its parental guaranty to the project, but it has informed the Company that no specific commitment regarding completion of the New Units has been agreed to by it so far.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Toshiba also announced that it had requested (and successfully received) a one-month extension of the deadline for submitting its securities report to Japanese securities regulators for the quarter ended December 31, 2016 to allow an internal investigation into the adequacy of internal controls relating to the purchase price allocation process for WECs acquisition of Stone & Webster and concerns that senior management at WEC may have  exerted inappropriate pressure in order to advance the purchase price allocation process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the announcement, it was stated that Toshibas audit committee was concerned that an invalidation of internal controls (or even the possibility thereof) might affect Toshibas quarterly financial statements, and that two law firms had been separately retained by the audit committee and WEC to assist with this investigation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although progress on the project was seen in December 2016 and January 2017, including the placement of the first of Unit 2s two steam generators, significant risks and uncertainties remain concerning WECs ability to improve work force efficiency and productivity performance and to continue to fulfill its performance and financial commitments and Toshibas ability to perform under its payment guaranty with respect to the project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, there can be no assurance that their creditors will continue to provide support or that other sources of liquidity will emerge or continue to be available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event that WEC were to fail to complete the project in breach of its obligations under the EPC Contract, its payment obligations for damages would increase substantially above the amount of the liquidated damages described above, but would still be subject to limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and Santee Cooper, the co-owner of the New Units, continue to evaluate various actions which might be taken in the event that Toshiba and WEC are unable or unwilling to complete the project.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include completing the work under possible arrangements with other contractors or, were it determined to be prudent, halting the project and leaving SCE&G to pursue cost recovery under the abandonment provisions of the BLRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, in response to these developments and in light of the DRB-established construction milestone payment schedule, in February 2017, SCE&G initiated its solicitation for increased levels of standby letters of credit in lieu of payment and performance bonds referred to above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, it is uncertain whether such additional levels of standby letters of credit will be available at reasonable cost or whether any letters of credit will continue to be renewed by their issuers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, additional claims by the Consortium or SCE&G involving the project schedule, budget and performance may arise as the project continues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The parties to the EPC Contract have established both informal and formal dispute resolution procedures in order to resolve such issues, and SCE&G expects to resolve disputes through those means.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G expects to seek recovery through rates of any project costs that arise through such dispute resolution processes, as well as other project costs identified from time to time; however, any such request would be subject to the provisions of the November 2016 SCPSC order discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There can be no assurance that recovery would be granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Santee Cooper Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, SCE&G has agreed to acquire an additional 5% ownership in the New Units from Santee Cooper.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of this agreement, SCE&G will acquire a 1% ownership interest in the New Units at the commercial operation date of Unit 2, an additional 2% ownership interest no later than the first anniversary of such commercial operation date, and the final 2% no later than the second anniversary of such commercial operation date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G has agreed to pay an amount equal to Santee Coopers actual cost, including its cost of financing, of the percentage conveyed as of the date of each conveyance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the agreement provides that Santee Cooper will not transfer any of its remaining interest in the New Units to third parties until the New Units are complete.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This transaction is subject to customary closing conditions, including receipt of necessary regulatory approvals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This transaction will not affect the payment obligations between the parties during construction of the New Units, nor is it anticipated that the payments for the additional ownership interest would be reflected in a revised rates filing under the BLRA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&Gs current projected cost for the additional 5% interest being acquired from Santee Cooper is approximately $850 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nuclear Production Tax Credits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The IRS has notified SCE&G that, subject to a national megawatt capacity limitation, the electricity to be produced by each of the New Units (advanced nuclear units, as defined) would qualify for nuclear production tax credits under Section 45J of the IRC to the extent that such New Unit is operational before January 1, 2021 and other eligibility requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These nuclear production tax credits (related to SCE&Gs 55% share of both New Units) could total as much as approximately $1.4 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such credits would be earned over the first eight years of each New Units operations and would be realized by SCE&G over those years or during allowable carry-forward periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on current tax law and the contractual guaranteed substantial completion dates (and the recently revised forecasted dates of completion) provided above, both New Units would be operational and would qualify for the nuclear production tax credits; however, any further delays in the schedule or changes in tax law could adversely impact these conclusions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See also the Payment and Performance Obligations and Certain Related Uncertainties discussion above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When and to the extent that production tax credits are realized, their benefits are expected to be provided directly to SCE&Gs electric customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Project Matters
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the NRC issued the COLs for the New Units, two of the conditions that it imposed were requiring inspection and testing of certain components of the New Units passive cooling system, and requiring the development of strategies to respond to extreme natural events resulting in the loss of power at the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the NRC directed the Office of New Reactors to issue to SCE&G an order requiring enhanced, reliable spent fuel pool instrumentation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G prepared and submitted an overall integration plan for the New Units to the NRC in August 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That plan remains under review by the NRC and SCE&G does not anticipate any additional regulatory actions as a result of that review, but it cannot predict future regulatory activities or how such initiatives would impact construction or operation of the New Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Environmental
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys operations are subject to extensive regulation by various federal and state authorities in the areas of air quality, water quality, control of toxic substances and hazardous and solid wastes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Applicable statutes and rules include the CAA, CWA, Nuclear Waste Act and CERCLA, among others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In many cases, regulations proposed by such authorities could have a significant impact on the Companys financial condition, results of operations and cash flows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company often cannot predict what conditions or requirements will be imposed by regulatory or legislative proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the extent that compliance with environmental regulations or legislation results in capital expenditures or operating costs, the Company expects to recover such expenditures and costs through existing ratemaking provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From a regulatory perspective, SCANA, SCE&G and GENCO continually monitor and evaluate their current and projected emission levels and strive to comply with all state and federal regulations regarding those emissions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and GENCO participate in the SO2  and NOX emission allowance programs with respect to coal plant emissions and also have constructed additional pollution control equipment at several larger coal-fired electric generating plants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, SCE&G is engaged in construction activities of the New Units which are expected to reduce GHG emission levels
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: significantly once they are completed and dispatched by potentially displacing some of the current coal-fired generation sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These actions are expected to address many of the rules and regulations discussed herein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On August 3, 2015, the EPA issued a revised standard for new power plants by re-proposing NSPS under the CAA for emissions of CO2  from newly constructed fossil fuel-fired units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final rule requires all new coal-fired power plants to meet a carbon emission rate of 1,400 pounds CO2  per MWh and new natural gas units to meet 1,000 pounds CO2  per MWh.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While most new natural gas plants will not be required to include any new technologies, no new coal-fired plants could be constructed without partial carbon capture and sequestration capabilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is monitoring the final rule, but does not plan to construct new coal-fired units in the foreseeable future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, on August 3, 2015, the EPA issued its final rule on emission guidelines for states to follow in developing plans to address GHG emissions from existing units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rule includes state-specific goals for reducing national CO2  emissions by 32% from 2005 levels by 2030.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rule also provides for nuclear reactors under construction, such as the New Units, to count towards compliance and establishes a phased-in compliance approach beginning in 2022.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rule gives each state from one to three years to issue SIPs, which will ultimately define the specific compliance methodology that will be applied to existing units in that state.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On February 9, 2016, the Supreme Court stayed the rule pending disposition of a petition of review of the rule in the Court of Appeals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The order of the Supreme Court has no immediate impact on SCE&G and GENCO or their generation operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects any costs incurred to comply with such rule to be recoverable through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2011, the EPA issued the CSAPR to reduce emissions of SO2  and NOX  from power plants in the eastern half of the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CSAPR replaces the CAIR and requires a total of 28 states to reduce annual SO2  emissions and annual and ozone season NOX  emissions to assist in attaining the ozone and fine particle NAAQS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rule establishes an emissions cap for SO2  and NOX  and limits the trading for emission allowances by separating affected states into two groups with no trading between the groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The State of South Carolina has chosen to remain in the CSAPR program, even though recent court rulings exempted the state.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This allows the state to remain compliant with regional haze standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Air quality control installations that SCE&G and GENCO have already completed have positioned them to comply with the existing allowances set by the CSAPR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any costs incurred to comply with CSAPR are expected to be recoverable through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2012, the EPAs MATS rule containing new standards for mercury and other specified air pollutants became effective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The MATS rule has been the subject of ongoing litigation even while it remains in effect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rulings on this litigation are not expected to have an impact on SCE&G or GENCO due to plant retirements, conversions, and enhancements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and GENCO are in compliance with the MATS rule and expect to remain in compliance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CWA provides for the imposition of effluent limitations that require treatment for wastewater discharges.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the CWA, compliance with applicable limitations is achieved under state-issued NPDES permits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a facilitys NPDES permit is renewed (every five years), any new effluent limitations would be incorporated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ELG Rule became effective on January 4, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After this date, state regulators will modify facility NPDES permits to match more restrictive standards, thus requiring facilities to retrofit with new wastewater treatment technologies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance dates will vary by type of wastewater, and some will be based on a facilitys five year permit cycle and thus may range from 2018 to 2023.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects that wastewater treatment technology retrofits will be required at Williams and Wateree Stations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any costs incurred to comply with the ELG Rule are expected to be recoverable through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CWA Section 316(b) Existing Facilities Rule became effective in October 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This rule establishes national requirements for the location, design, construction and capacity of cooling water intake structures at existing facilities that reflect the best technology available for minimizing the adverse environmental impacts of impingement and entrainment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and GENCO are conducting studies and implementing plans as required by the rule to determine appropriate intake structure modifications to ensure compliance with this rule.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any costs incurred to comply with this rule are expected to be recoverable through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The EPAs final rule for CCR became effective in the fourth quarter of 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This rule regulates CCR as a non-hazardous waste under Subtitle D of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act and imposes certain requirements on ash storage ponds and other CCR management facilities at SCE&Gs and GENCOs coal-fired generating facilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS (Continued)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and GENCO have already closed or have begun the process of closure of all of their ash storage ponds and have previously recognized AROs for such ash storage ponds under existing requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not expect the incremental compliance costs associated with this rule to be significant and expects to recover such costs in future rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nuclear Waste Act required that the United States government accept and permanently dispose of high-level radioactive waste and spent nuclear fuel by January 31, 1998, and it imposed on utilities the primary responsibility for storage of their spent nuclear fuel until the repository is available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G entered into a Standard Contract for Disposal of Spent Nuclear Fuel and/or High-Level Radioactive Waste with the DOE in 1983.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, the federal government has not accepted any spent fuel from Unit 1, and it remains unclear when the repository may become available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G has constructed an independent spent fuel storage installation to accommodate the spent nuclear fuel output for the life of Unit 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G may evaluate other technology as it becomes available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The provisions of CERCLA authorize the EPA to require the clean-up of hazardous waste sites.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The states of South Carolina and North Carolina have similar laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains an environmental assessment program to identify and evaluate current and former operations sites that could require clean-up.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, regulators from the EPA and other federal or state agencies periodically notify the Company that it may be required to perform or participate in the investigation and remediation of a hazardous waste site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As site assessments are initiated, estimates are made of the amount of expenditures, if any, deemed necessary to investigate and remediate each site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These estimates are refined as additional information becomes available; therefore, actual expenditures may differ significantly from the original estimates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts estimated and accrued to date for site assessments and clean-up relate solely to regulated operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such amounts are recorded in regulatory assets and amortized, with recovery provided through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G is responsible for four decommissioned MGP sites in South Carolina which contain residues of by-product chemicals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sites are in various stages of investigation, remediation and monitoring under work plans approved by DHEC and the EPA.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G anticipates that major remediation activities at all these sites will continue at least through 2018 and will cost an additional $10.2 million, which is accrued in Other within Deferred Credits and Other Liabilities on the consolidated balance sheet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G expects to recover any cost arising from the remediation of MGP sites through rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At December 31, 2016, deferred amounts, net of amounts previously recovered through rates and insurance settlements, totaled $25.7 million and are included in regulatory assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is subject to various claims and litigation incidental to its business operations which management anticipates will be resolved without a material impact on the Companys results of operations, cash flows or financial condition.

sentences.text: SCANA issues guarantees on behalf of its consolidated subsidiaries to facilitate commercial transactions with third parties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guarantees are in the form of performance guarantees, primarily for the purchase and transportation of natural gas, standby letters of credit issued by financial institutions and credit support for certain tax-exempt bond issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA is not required to recognize a liability for such guarantees unless it becomes probable that performance under the guarantees will be required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANA believes the likelihood that it would be required to perform or otherwise incur any losses associated with these guarantees is remote; therefore, no liability for these guarantees has been recognized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A liability for the present value of an ARO is recognized when incurred if the liability can be reasonably estimated.

sentences.text: Uncertainty about the timing or method of settlement of a conditional ARO is factored into the measurement of the liability when sufficient information exists, but such uncertainty is not a basis upon which to avoid liability recognition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The legal obligations associated with the retirement of long-lived tangible assets that result from their acquisition, construction, development and normal operation relate primarily to the Companys regulated utility operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, SCE&G has recorded AROs of approximately $199 million for nuclear plant decommissioning (see Note 1).

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has recorded AROs of approximately $359 million for other conditional obligations primarily related to other generation, transmission and distribution properties, including gas pipelines.

sentences.text: SEGMENT OF BUSINESS INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reportable segments, which are described below, follow the same accounting policies as those described in Note 1 and reflect the effect of certain reclassifications described therein.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Intersegment sales and transfers of electricity and gas are recorded based on rates established by the appropriate regulatory authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonregulated sales and transfers are recorded at current market prices.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Electric Operations primarily generates, transmits and distributes electricity, and is regulated by the SCPSC and FERC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas Distribution, comprised of the local distribution operations of SCE&G and PSNC Energy, purchases and sells natural gas, primarily at retail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCE&G and PSNC Energy are regulated by the SCPSC and the NCUC, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas Marketing is comprised of the marketing operations of SCANA Energy, which markets natural gas to retail customers in Georgia and to industrial and large commercial customers and municipalities in the Southeast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other includes the parent company, a services company and other nonreportable segments that were insignificant for all periods presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, All Other includes gains from the sales of CGT and SCI (see Note 1) and their operating results and assets prior to their sale in the first quarter of 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CGT and SCI were nonreportable segments during all periods presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: External revenue and intersegment revenue for All Other related to CGT and SCI were not significant during any period presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regulated reportable segments share a similar regulatory environment and, in some cases, overlapping service areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Electric Operations product differs from the other segments, as does its generation process and method of distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gas Marketing operates in a deregulated environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management uses operating income to measure segment profitability for its regulated operations and evaluates utility plant, net, for segments attributable to SCE&G.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, no allocation is made to segments for interest charges, income tax expense or assets other than utility plant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For nonregulated operations, management uses net income as the measure of segment profitability and evaluates total assets for financial position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest income is not reported by segment and is not material.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred tax assets are netted with deferred tax liabilities for consolidated reporting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consolidated financial statements report operating revenues which are comprised of the energy-related and regulated segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenue from non-reportable and nonregulated segments are included in Other Income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore the adjustments to total operating revenues remove revenues from non-reportable segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments to net income consist of the unallocated net income of regulated reportable segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Segment Assets include utility plant, net for SCE&Gs Electric Operations and Gas Distribution, and all assets for PSNC Energy and the remaining segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, adjustments to assets include non-utility plant and non-fixed assets for SCE&G.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments to Interest Expense, Income Tax Expense, Expenditures for Assets and Deferred Tax Assets include primarily the amounts that are not allocated to the segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest Expense is also adjusted to eliminate charges between affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adjustments to Depreciation and Amortization consist of non-reportable segment expenses, which are not included in the depreciation and amortization reported on a consolidated basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expenditures for Assets are adjusted for AFC and revisions to estimated cash flows related to AROs, and totals not allocated to other segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Tax Assets are adjusted to net them against deferred tax liabilities on a consolidated basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reportable segments have changed from what was reported as of December 31, 2015 to combine the former Retail Gas Marketing and Energy Marketing segments into a single Gas Marketing segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change in reportable segments occurred due to changes in the structure of the Companys internal organization which included the integration of strategic planning and reporting for these business units and the related integration of the chief operating decision makers assessment of performance and resource allocation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corresponding amounts in prior periods have been revised to conform to the current presentation.

sentences.text: MANAGEMENT REPORT ON INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The management of SCANA is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANAs internal control system was designed by or under the supervision of SCANAs management, including its CEO and CFO, to provide reasonable assurance to SCANAs management and board of directors regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All internal control systems, no matter how well designed, have inherent limitations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, even those systems determined to be effective can provide only reasonable assurance with respect to financial statement preparation and presentation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, the effectiveness of the internal control over financial reporting may deteriorate in future periods due to either changes in conditions or declining levels of compliance with policies or procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANAs management assessed the effectiveness of SCANAs internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this assessment, SCANA used the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in Internal ControlIntegrated Framework (2013).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this assessment, SCANAs management believes that, as of December 31, 2016, internal control over financial reporting is effective based on those criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SCANAs independent registered public accounting firm has issued an attestation report on SCANAs internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This report follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM ON INTERNAL CONTROL OVER FINANCIAL REPORTING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Board of Directors and Stockholders of SCANA Corporation Cayce, South Carolina
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have audited the internal control over financial reporting of SCANA Corporation and subsidiaries (the "Company") as of December 31, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in the accompanying Management Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the Companys internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A companys internal control over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the supervision of, the companys principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, and effected by the companys board of directors, management, and other personnel to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A companys internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the companys assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the inherent limitations of internal control over financial reporting, including the possibility of collusion or improper management override of controls, material misstatements due to error or fraud may not be prevented or detected on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, projections of any evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control over financial reporting to future periods are subject to the risk that the controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our opinion, the Company maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on the criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework (2013) issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States),  the consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 2016, of the Company and our report dated February 24, 2017, expressed an unqualified opinion on those financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enclosed with this letter is your proxy card, which shows the number of shares of SCANA Common Stock in which you have a beneficial interest under the SCANA Corporation 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (the Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have the right to instruct Bank of America, N.A., as Trustee of the Plan, how these shares should be voted at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to the provisions of the Plan, the Trustee is empowered to vote the shares held in the Plan on behalf of participants in accordance with their directions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order for your voting instructions to be received by the Trustee in time to be voted at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders on Thursday, April 27, 2017, your proxy must be received by Tuesday, April 25, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote your proxy electronically by the internet or telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internet and telephone voting permit you to vote at your convenience, 24 hours a day, seven days a week.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also complete, date, sign and return the enclosed card promptly in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will enable the Trustee to obtain your instructions for voting the shares of SCANA Common Stock in your Plan account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed voting instructions are included on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the absence of your instructions, these shares will be voted by the Trustee in the same proportion as the directed shares in the Plan are voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The matters to be acted upon at the meeting are more fully set forth in the Notice of Annual Meeting and Proxy Statement, which is also enclosed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have any questions, you may call the SCANA Corporation Retirement Plans Department at 803-217-9465.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jimmy E. Addison, Chairman 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
